subject: Properly set distro branch in DLRN when STABLE_RELEASE=newton
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 12:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Properly set distro branch in DLRN when STABLE_RELEASE=newton

RDO changed the distgit branch for stable releases in newton, using
newton-rdo instead of rpm-newton. This was done to unify specs
between RDO Trunk and final versions, but Tripleo CI was not updated
to match.

Without this patch, DLRN will try to use a non-existing rpm-newton
branch for Netwon stable releases, always defaulting to rpm-master.

Change-Id: I4268dd2b4814d0d223fdb897cccfaf950567d0cd
'}]
commit_message:
Properly set distro branch in DLRN when STABLE_RELEASE=newton

RDO changed the distgit branch for stable releases in newton, using
newton-rdo instead of rpm-newton. This was done to unify specs
between RDO Trunk and final versions, but Tripleo CI was not updated
to match.

Without this patch, DLRN will try to use a non-existing rpm-newton
branch for Netwon stable releases, always defaulting to rpm-master.

Change-Id: I4268dd2b4814d0d223fdb897cccfaf950567d0cd

commit_message:
initial chkin of all of trove integration elements into trove.

This is the first of a string of commits that will get rid of
trove-integration.

This commit moves the image elements into Trove and provides an image
builder tool (see image/bin/trove-image-builder.bash)

Change-Id: I13af9ae6d7f90438dd411f0b96ec618621dcac65
Partially-Implements: eliminate-trove-integration-and-redstack

commit_message:
Nested keys handled for get operation

Nested key can be specified with '.' separator: key1.key2.key3.
Nested keys handled in the API and in the fuel2.
Tests for keys operations moved from the test for resource values
to the test for resource key operations.

Change-Id: I73b5fd9a4a4720a96af351d7e6a7cea14d816f75
Partial-Bug: #1642330

commit_message:
External openvswitch

Some clouds must use openvswitch on the host in order to provide
connectivity to the rest of the systems. This patch set tests the
use case to ensure it works.

Change-Id: I9750facf9a54c052f7eb7c4045130c341ea9209f

A large part of the change is making the DB APIs use the

commit_message:
WIP Experimenting with CellDatabases test fixture

This attempts a test fixture that switches between multiple sqlite
in-memory databases for functional testing of cells v2.

A large part of the change is making the DB APIs use the
pick_context_manager method instead of assuming local DB access
within a cell. Assuming local DB access for cell DB tables not
accessed from the API works in real life, but makes it impossible
to patch in a testing situation because of the global nature of
main_context_manager.

Change-Id: I590b211d56aa54f688df4e904d98e28024544a97

subject: Add admin role for masakari user
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 10:34:56.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Add admin role for masakari user

Masakari API's are allowed to be execute by admin only. So when external
service like masakari-instancemonitor calls masakari-api using masakari
user it does not have admin role associated with it's tenant. So it
returns HTTPForbidden 403 response to masakari-instancemonitor.

Added admin role to service tenant which has masakari user associated
with.

Change-Id: I505ea56bc022aad086f1090ff25b59ec85b70c41
"}]
commit_message:
Add admin role for masakari user

Masakari API's are allowed to be execute by admin only. So when external
service like masakari-instancemonitor calls masakari-api using masakari
user it does not have admin role associated with it's tenant. So it
returns HTTPForbidden 403 response to masakari-instancemonitor.

Added admin role to service tenant which has masakari user associated
with.

Change-Id: I505ea56bc022aad086f1090ff25b59ec85b70c41

commit_message:
Allow admin users to backfill data

Ignores the usual timestamp limitations for admin users.  This will allow backfilling
data through the api, as well as migrations between dbs using the api to pull and post.

Change-Id: I72374d45421a6c53f57362c7f62db4ae6df4d6b2

commit_message:
Add flavor extra_spec info link to api_ref

In the current api-ref, we have illustrated
about how to add extra specs for flavors,
but it was very simple and we have a large
number of built-in extra specs that can be
used to archive different purpose listed here:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/compute-flavors.html

The reader will still be confused about how
to correctly use extra specs only read the
api-ref. We could first simply add the above
link to the flavor extra spec section in
api-ref to let readers know where to find
information and come up with better solution
later.

Change-Id: Ie720973783f153d3954be9f4bd97e7f9bf788c6b
Closes-bug: #1640654
(cherry picked from commit da1148a7a759a6e54be1688b7a2d73e19498099d)

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-18 07:03:10.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/deployment_tasks.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/tasks_serializer.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_graph_related_handlers.py'], 'message': 'Avoid creating tasks with empty nodes list

For a granular deploy when a node is deleted and deployment is
triggered the list of nodes for deploy is empty and all remaining nodes
are in the list of affected nodes. This causes nonreexecutable tasks to

Change-Id: I7377c50df87d1f2448ac2bc775840738d535d7fd

commit_message:
Avoid creating tasks with empty nodes list

For a granular deploy when a node is deleted and deployment is
triggered the list of nodes for deploy is empty and all remaining nodes
are in the list of affected nodes. This causes nonreexecutable tasks to
appear in the list of tasks with empty uids array.
This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I7377c50df87d1f2448ac2bc775840738d535d7fd
Closes-Bug: #1628500
(cherry picked from commit 70ebe005390bfa475801dcba8b3dc1374996a994)

commit_message:
Proposal to count resources to check quota in API for cells

Resources should be counted to check quota in the API to minimize
coupling between the API cell and compute cells.

Related to blueprint cells-count-resources-to-check-quota-in-api

subject: Neutron plugin cannot create multiple subnets
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4656, 'name': 'Sean M. Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15321, 'name': 'Matthew Van Dijk', 'email': 'mvandijk@tesora.com', 'username': 'mvandijk'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-23 15:14:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3'], 'message': "Neutron plugin cannot create multiple subnets

The Neutron plugin in devstack has hard-coded values for subnet
creation.  In Trove we need to create a network/subnets for the alt_demo
tenant, however that is not possible using the neutron plugin methods.
Passing in some of the variables to the neutron_create_private_subnet_*
methods allows different subnet creation without duplicating the
Neutron plugin code.

The '_' was removed from the two functions to indicate that they can
now be called from outside the Neutron plugin.

Change-Id: I865009d534412b8bdd0973b7af5adbb5fb1047ba
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron plugin cannot create multiple subnets

The Neutron plugin in devstack has hard-coded values for subnet
creation.  In Trove we need to create a network/subnets for the alt_demo
tenant, however that is not possible using the neutron plugin methods.
Passing in some of the variables to the neutron_create_private_subnet_*
methods allows different subnet creation without duplicating the
Neutron plugin code.

The '_' was removed from the two functions to indicate that they can
now be called from outside the Neutron plugin.

Change-Id: I865009d534412b8bdd0973b7af5adbb5fb1047ba

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-19 16:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/remotefs/test_windows_remotefs.py', 'os_brick/remotefs/windows_remotefs.py'], 'message': "Windows remotefs: create mountpoints at the expected location

In order to support running inside a Scale-Out File Server cluster,
when 'mounting' a local share, we're creating a symlink to the local
export path without actually creating a SMB mapping.

The issue is that instead of creating a symlink using the hash of
the share UNC path, we're using the local export path instead. This
is undesired behavior, in which case the caller will not be able
to find the 'mountpoint'.

This change addresses this issue, ensuring that we're using the
mountpoint expected by the caller (e.g. the Cinder SMB driver)
when mounting SMB shares.

Closes-Bug: #1631351

Change-Id: I6bf909da559a745596f7d4c30d12e794b0b156de
"}]
commit_message:
Windows remotefs: create mountpoints at the expected location

In order to support running inside a Scale-Out File Server cluster,
when 'mounting' a local share, we're creating a symlink to the local
export path without actually creating a SMB mapping.

The issue is that instead of creating a symlink using the hash of
the share UNC path, we're using the local export path instead. This
is undesired behavior, in which case the caller will not be able
to find the 'mountpoint'.

This change addresses this issue, ensuring that we're using the
mountpoint expected by the caller (e.g. the Cinder SMB driver)
when mounting SMB shares.

Closes-Bug: #1631351

Change-Id: I6bf909da559a745596f7d4c30d12e794b0b156de

subject: Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 04:48:10.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_base_iscsi.py'], 'message': "Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittesttools, assertDictEqual() and assertEqual()
are implemented by using '!=' operator. But assertEqual()
can handle dict, list, set and so on. So we just call
assertEqual() to make the tests simpler.

Change-Id: If4b7524c07cfac7f705ee466bef02b7de161f8bb
"}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittesttools, assertDictEqual() and assertEqual()
are implemented by using '!=' operator. But assertEqual()
can handle dict, list, set and so on. So we just call
assertEqual() to make the tests simpler.

Change-Id: If4b7524c07cfac7f705ee466bef02b7de161f8bb

subject: Drop py33 support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-27 01:46:50.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: Ia5dba7d192e283bc1ba2ab24868402ab4a958870
'}]
commit_message:
Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: Ia5dba7d192e283bc1ba2ab24868402ab4a958870

commit_message:
Replace hard-coded haproxy/keepalived coupling

We have a variable in hiera which tells us if the keepalived
service is enabled, so use it here.  Without this any deployment
disabling OS::TripleO::Services::Keepalived will fail.

Change-Id: I90faf51881bd05920067c1e1d82baf5d7586af23
Closes-Bug: #1642677

commit_message:
Adds OpenDaylight local OVSDB listener

With neutron switching OVSDB configuration to be done via the 'native'
library, OVSDB needs to be listening on a port to accept RPCs.  This
adds a default listener on a non-common port and sets the URI for
Neutron when using OpenDaylight so that agents may add ports to OVS.

Change-Id: Ic651bc9d28f45491846b6ad1048fbc975b3e2141
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 81d139edc939c8842893b342ecb1a5795724518c)

subject: Added updating docker containers to update_fuel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 16:14:46.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/helpers/decorators.py'], 'message': 'Added updating docker containers to update_fuel

systemd update may lead to situation that docker and docker containers
can be suspended.
Now update_fuel function stops containers, deletes all images, stops
docker daemon before update. Then starts docker and loads new images
after update.

Change-Id: If8adaf02d9a4c8a4b9ce23aa24001cef1bac8878
Closes-bug: #1635563
(cherry picked from commit 2916c8c0f2ae8f6795327f55990a8c58eeade7a0)
'}]
commit_message:
Added updating docker containers to update_fuel

systemd update may lead to situation that docker and docker containers
can be suspended.
Now update_fuel function stops containers, deletes all images, stops
docker daemon before update. Then starts docker and loads new images
after update.

Change-Id: If8adaf02d9a4c8a4b9ce23aa24001cef1bac8878
Closes-bug: #1635563
(cherry picked from commit 2916c8c0f2ae8f6795327f55990a8c58eeade7a0)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-17 19:15:54.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Add worker config envs in toci_gate_test

Because tripleo.sh now sources deploy.env on every run, we can't
make changes to deploy args in deploy.sh.  Instead we can add the
appropriate envs to the deploy args in toci_gate_test.  This also
means we need to regenerate the update args with the new deploy
args.

Change-Id: Ibc0e577b138c712d3fd4bbc5186b73cc33d244bd
Partial-Bug: 1642429
"}]
commit_message:
Add worker config envs in toci_gate_test

Because tripleo.sh now sources deploy.env on every run, we can't
make changes to deploy args in deploy.sh.  Instead we can add the
appropriate envs to the deploy args in toci_gate_test.  This also
means we need to regenerate the update args with the new deploy
args.

Change-Id: Ibc0e577b138c712d3fd4bbc5186b73cc33d244bd

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 13:39:40.000000000', 'files': ['tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh'], 'message': 'Fixed functional iptables firewall tests for newer kernels

Iptables functional tests fail on Xenial and other newer kernels if
br_netfilter kernel module is not loaded, in which case sysctl knobs to
enable bridge firewalling are not available, and attempt to set them
with _enable_netfilter_for_bridges fails.

We should load the kernel module before running those tests. Luckily,
devstack has a function for just that (plus more).

Change-Id: I602d8cd02c73b18e9d719b19998e36059ae28cd8
Depends-On: Id6bfd9595f0772a63d1096ef83ebbb6cd630fafd
Related-Bug: #1622914
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed functional iptables firewall tests for newer kernels

Iptables functional tests fail on Xenial and other newer kernels if
br_netfilter kernel module is not loaded, in which case sysctl knobs to
enable bridge firewalling are not available, and attempt to set them
with _enable_netfilter_for_bridges fails.

We should load the kernel module before running those tests. Luckily,
devstack has a function for just that (plus more).

Change-Id: I602d8cd02c73b18e9d719b19998e36059ae28cd8
Depends-On: Id6bfd9595f0772a63d1096ef83ebbb6cd630fafd
Related-Bug: #1622914

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 15:31:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/volume/encryptors/test_luks.py', 'nova/volume/encryptors/luks.py', 'nova/volume/encryptors/cryptsetup.py', 'nova/tests/unit/volume/encryptors/test_cryptsetup.py'], 'message': "encryptors: Workaround mangled passphrases

Prior to Ib563b0ea the passphrase used by CryptsetupEncryptor and
LuksEncryptor had any leading zeros per hexadecimal digit removed, for
example 0x04 or 04 would turn into 0x4 or 4. As a result any volume
encrypted prior to the release of Newton used a modified passphrase that
was different to that stored by the key manager being used in the
environment.

To correct this for LuksEncryptor volumes permission denied errors are
now caught when attempting to open a volume. A second attempt to open
the volume is then made using a mangled passphrase. If successful the
correct passphrase is then added to the volume before the mangled
passphrase is finally removed. This workaround can be removed in a
future release once it is safe to assume that all LuksEncryptor volumes
have had any mangled passphrases replaced in this way.

This isn't possible for CryptsetupEncryptor volumes as the plain mode
used by cryptsetup does not provide a way for adding and removing keys.
As such on a permission denied error a second attempt is made to open
the volume using a mangled passphrase. Unlike the above workaround this
cannot be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: I7096463c5eba951dd6322ee6965435e877ca0371
Partial-bug: #1633518
(cherry picked from commit 2010c13c0a229531a1ec3c84fb9c05e7310cf824)
"}]
commit_message:
encryptors: Workaround mangled passphrases

Prior to Ib563b0ea the passphrase used by CryptsetupEncryptor and
LuksEncryptor had any leading zeros per hexadecimal digit removed, for
example 0x04 or 04 would turn into 0x4 or 4. As a result any volume
encrypted prior to the release of Newton used a modified passphrase that
was different to that stored by the key manager being used in the
environment.

To correct this for LuksEncryptor volumes permission denied errors are
now caught when attempting to open a volume. A second attempt to open
the volume is then made using a mangled passphrase. If successful the
correct passphrase is then added to the volume before the mangled
passphrase is finally removed. This workaround can be removed in a
future release once it is safe to assume that all LuksEncryptor volumes
have had any mangled passphrases replaced in this way.

This isn't possible for CryptsetupEncryptor volumes as the plain mode
used by cryptsetup does not provide a way for adding and removing keys.
As such on a permission denied error a second attempt is made to open
the volume using a mangled passphrase. Unlike the above workaround this
cannot be removed in a future release.

Change-Id: I7096463c5eba951dd6322ee6965435e877ca0371
Partial-bug: #1633518
(cherry picked from commit 2010c13c0a229531a1ec3c84fb9c05e7310cf824)

commit_message:
Multi-Region Support

This is an initial attempt at supporting multiple regions.  It should
handle the mechanics of deploying an instance/volume to a remote
region.  Additional changes may be required to allow the guest
agent on the instance to connect back to the originating region.

Co-Authored-By: Petr Malik <pmalik@tesora.com>
Change-Id: I780de59dae5f90955139ab8393cf7d59ff3a21f6

commit_message:
Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I15cbb71d028e9297cb49b5aab7d0427f7be36c49

commit_message:

can go about doing so.

A minor typo fix is included in the 'compute-cpu-topologies' to ensure
"huge pages" is the term used throughout all docs.

should have some developer docs that describe the basic steps for

Change-Id: I98171d5a81cab10020cbaa166bc649bacf7d5a67

commit_message:
Add developer docs for keystone-manage doctor

``keyestone-manage doctor`` is a thing, but we don't really provide
any sort of developer documentation on how to write checks for it. We
should have some developer docs that describe the basic steps for
writing new symptoms ``doctor`` should check for.

Change-Id: I98171d5a81cab10020cbaa166bc649bacf7d5a67
Closes-Bug: 1641623

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 6995, 'name': 'Sridar Kandaswamy', 'email': 'skandasw@yahoo.com', 'username': 'skandasw'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 17711, 'name': 'Margaret Frances', 'email': 'margaret_frances@cable.comcast.com', 'username': 'margaret-frances'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-18 15:14:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/neutron-fwaas.yaml'], 'message': "Manage NEUTRON_API_EXTENSIONS for neutron-fwaas tempest jobs

The neutron-fwaas project defines a fwaas_v1 API and a fwaas_v2 API,
both of which are supported at this time.  In order to write tempest
tests for both APIs, we are using the require_ext decorator to check for
the right extension being loaded.  But without managing the
NEUTRON_API_EXTENSIONS variable this defaults to 'all'.

This change manages the NEUTRON_API_EXTENSIONS for the appropriate
neutron-fwaas tempest test definitions to solve this issue.

Change-Id: I0c663181511f5ae7521b8df0acce2be016a25ffc
"}]
commit_message:
Manage NEUTRON_API_EXTENSIONS for neutron-fwaas tempest jobs

The neutron-fwaas project defines a fwaas_v1 API and a fwaas_v2 API,
both of which are supported at this time.  In order to write tempest
tests for both APIs, we are using the require_ext decorator to check for
the right extension being loaded.  But without managing the
NEUTRON_API_EXTENSIONS variable this defaults to 'all'.

This change manages the NEUTRON_API_EXTENSIONS for the appropriate
neutron-fwaas tempest test definitions to solve this issue.

Change-Id: I0c663181511f5ae7521b8df0acce2be016a25ffc

commit_message:
Add tuned check to remote provision role

Building off of work from dmsimard[1] and tied to LP:1639327[2]
It has been identified that we can increase performance over
the default power saving profile during deployments with tuned[3].

[1] - https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/3529/2/playbooks/host-preparation.yml
[2] - https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo-quickstart/+bug/1639327
[3] - https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/6/html/Power_Management_Guide/tuned-adm.html

Change-Id: Ib58b1a2b32fb700fa576533b7d26965ce8f1a083

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-16 13:33:57.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Increase Mistral Task Size limit

When selecting environments to deploy from the UI, every environment
filename gets added individually to 'environments' key in the Mistral
environment. Apparently it means we hit the Mistral execution size
limit pretty quickly.

This isn't needed for the CLI at this point because it bunches all the
environment files together into one big "user-environments.yaml" file,
for backwards-compabitility reasons.

Note that this Mistral value seems to affect both input and output for
task execution, which is why this patch was initially created as a
prerequisite for Ia9d2312e942229b659cfc65d4c370874e87f44da.

Change-Id: I24453b6d83171860065b050f437602e1f655d8b8
Closes-Bug: #1640815
(cherry picked from commit 4ee68a5229bed653a669826e45108d25f207c024)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase Mistral Task Size limit

When selecting environments to deploy from the UI, every environment
filename gets added individually to 'environments' key in the Mistral
environment. Apparently it means we hit the Mistral execution size
limit pretty quickly.

This isn't needed for the CLI at this point because it bunches all the
environment files together into one big "user-environments.yaml" file,
for backwards-compabitility reasons.

Note that this Mistral value seems to affect both input and output for
task execution, which is why this patch was initially created as a
prerequisite for Ia9d2312e942229b659cfc65d4c370874e87f44da.

Change-Id: I24453b6d83171860065b050f437602e1f655d8b8
Closes-Bug: #1640815
(cherry picked from commit 4ee68a5229bed653a669826e45108d25f207c024)

commit_message:
Pass the libvirt_uri to the pool-define command

The pool-define command seems to be defining the pool using the system
default connection uri instead of using `libvirt_uri`

commit_message:
NetApp Data ONTAP headroom calculation error

The NetApp Data ONTAP drivers contain a minor calculation error
that can lead to misstated controller utilization values used by
the filter & goodness functions.

Closes-Bug: #1631460
Change-Id: Idf6a33a388e732acd2f3154ac7d0a6490f8cf88e

commit_message:
Agent to OVO

This patch introduces Agent model class to Oslo Versioned Object.

Given the number of dependencies and methods that use the model class,
the integration patch will be created in separated patch.

Co-Authored-By: Tony Tan <tonytan198211@gmail.com>

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I4145b7f59b58a55c1a76b91618097ff69aee1568

subject: Fix usages view on project/overview page
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-16 17:41:46.000000000', 'files': ['manila_ui/dashboards/project/templates/_limit_summary.html', 'manila_ui/dashboards/project/templates/usage.html', 'manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/__init__.py', 'manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/tests.py'], 'message': "Fix usages view on project/overview page

Currently, Manila UI adds its own HTML template to project/overview
page for quota limits. It contains info for other projects.
It is fragile and redundant.

Therefore, delete that template, reusing original Horizon's one that
is flexible enough to display limits for any project.

Extend one of Horizon's view python-classes with Manila data that
will be picked up by HTML template. It is safe to do the same for
other Horizon plugins too.

Change-Id: I2e4cad33326c486352f340918395d4ee85ebe8e1
Closes-Bug: #1576791
Closes-Bug: #1630793
(clean cherry pick of commit ffe2f85b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix usages view on project/overview page

Currently, Manila UI adds its own HTML template to project/overview
page for quota limits. It contains info for other projects.
It is fragile and redundant.

Therefore, delete that template, reusing original Horizon's one that
is flexible enough to display limits for any project.

Extend one of Horizon's view python-classes with Manila data that
will be picked up by HTML template. It is safe to do the same for
other Horizon plugins too.

Change-Id: I2e4cad33326c486352f340918395d4ee85ebe8e1
Closes-Bug: #1576791
Closes-Bug: #1630793
(clean cherry pick of commit ffe2f85b)

subject: Stop dhclient in os-net-config if interface not set for DHCP
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-16 23:44:29.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/tests/test_impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'message': "Stop dhclient in os-net-config if interface not set for DHCP

As described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1640598,
there are situations in which the dhclient instance started by
dhcp-all-interfaces runs even after the interface is no longer
configured for DHCP.  This change will terminate the instance
using the '-r' argument if 'BOOTPROTO' is not set to 'dhcp' in
the ifcfg file for the interface.  The dhclient will only be
stopped if a dhclient pid file exists, the pid file will be
removed after stopping dhclient.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8a52ef5fb8052f185c01dcc27a1ecd70f5d630c8
Closes-Bug: 1640598
(cherry picked from commit fceeece7676c900e5295603f318c4218ac516bcb)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop dhclient in os-net-config if interface not set for DHCP

As described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1640598,
there are situations in which the dhclient instance started by
dhcp-all-interfaces runs even after the interface is no longer
configured for DHCP.  This change will terminate the instance
using the '-r' argument if 'BOOTPROTO' is not set to 'dhcp' in
the ifcfg file for the interface.  The dhclient will only be
stopped if a dhclient pid file exists, the pid file will be
removed after stopping dhclient.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8a52ef5fb8052f185c01dcc27a1ecd70f5d630c8
Closes-Bug: 1640598
(cherry picked from commit fceeece7676c900e5295603f318c4218ac516bcb)

commit_message:
correctly spell yaql_limit_iterators

A recent change (55ccd0e) introduced support for the yaql_memory_quota
and yaql_limit_iterators options in puppet-heat, but omitted the yaql_
prefix on limit_iterators.

Closes-Bug: #1642287
Change-Id: Ice258c8afcb501b1742487c3de572121dbec8a44
(cherry picked from commit 2c7c869699e8d1fe8eba10ddfcee531abad2dc7f)

subject: Properly pass arguments for language building
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-18 14:17:00.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix-langs-tox-c3ead8fa02de31fc.yaml', 'bin/doc-tools-check-languages'], 'message': 'Properly pass arguments for language building

tox 2.5.0 currently complains that it cannot find "sphinx-build arg1

commit_message:
Properly pass arguments for language building

Do not give sphinx-build as single argument, split it up.
tox 2.5.0 currently complains that it cannot find "sphinx-build arg1
arg2" - so, pass this properly now.

Add releasenote for this.

Change-Id: I5da1d06866c16a8c56be23e87817d163b28803a8

commit_message:
Revert "Fix: Creation of cluster without floating ip"

This is a policy violation as this change has not been merged on master.  I
understand the as yet Magnum doesn't assert eitehr of the stable:follows-policy or follows-standard-deprecation tags but still this review shoudl be
reverted until the discussion on master version concludes.

This reverts commit d7ad21fd38b996d601015d9f93102580522d55d9.

Change-Id: Ic1b7aac01e5359ca93453e0ed05ac78197542397

commit_message:
Adds distribution ID option to diskimage-create.sh

This patch adds a distribution ID option to the diskimage-create.sh
script used to create amphora images.  This will allow octavia
to control the timing of the transition to a new default release.
For Ocata it will default to "xenial".

Change-Id: I435cf9f4723fc9e68f8cb8987c8316b09e6876b6
Closes-Bug: 1642756

commit_message:
Bond attributes in interface API

Remove restrictions on set of BOND properties. Now BOND can have
any attributes.
Remove redundant `bond_properties`.

Change-Id: I60d1a0628d84c5ba49bb5b45824d660297dacccc
Implements: blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

commit_message:
Resolve tasks by role tags

This commit switching tasks resolution approach to the tags based one.
Tag - minimal unit what's necessary only for task resolution and can be
mapped to the node through the role interface only. Each role provides set
of tags in its 'tags' field and may be modified via role API. Tag may be
created separately via tag API, but, this tag can not be used unless it's
stuck to the role.

Change-Id: Icd78fd124997c8aafb07964eeb8e0f7dbb1b1cd2
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition

commit_message:
Added audit-enforce command

This command performs audit run on
the environment, associated with the target
repo. After that, if there are any outofsync
Puppet resources, it performs an enforcement
run, that will sync these resources.

subject: Correctly send 412 Precondition Failed in copy middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-17 17:50:05.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_quotas.py', 'swift/common/middleware/copy.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_copy.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_account_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Correctly send 412 Precondition Failed in copy middleware

Previously in copy middleware, if a user entered an invalid destination
path with an invalid `container/object` path the server would return
a 500 Internal Server Error. However, the correct response should be
a 412 Precondition Failed. This patch updates copy so that it catches
the 412 Precondition Failed exception and returns it to the client.

Closes-Bug: #1641980

Change-Id: Ic4677ae033d05b8730c6ad1041bd9c07268e11a9
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly send 412 Precondition Failed in copy middleware

Previously in copy middleware, if a user entered an invalid destination
path with an invalid `container/object` path the server would return
a 500 Internal Server Error. However, the correct response should be
a 412 Precondition Failed. This patch updates copy so that it catches
the 412 Precondition Failed exception and returns it to the client.

Closes-Bug: #1641980

Change-Id: Ic4677ae033d05b8730c6ad1041bd9c07268e11a9

The backport https://review.openstack.org/395718 mistakenly
included the usage of the variable 'neutron_pip_package_state'
which was introdiuced in master for the purpose of the
updated ansible-lint checks. This variable is not valid in
stable/newton.

This patch removes the variable and sets the state to 'latest'
as with all other pip install tasks.

Change-Id: I09518913d221abc73904949dc6c780310edabc5f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove mistaken 'neutron_pip_package_state' variable usage

The backport https://review.openstack.org/395718 mistakenly
included the usage of the variable 'neutron_pip_package_state'
which was introdiuced in master for the purpose of the
updated ansible-lint checks. This variable is not valid in
stable/newton.

This patch removes the variable and sets the state to 'latest'
as with all other pip install tasks.

Change-Id: I09518913d221abc73904949dc6c780310edabc5f

commit_message:
llow dynamic enable/disable of SRR capability

Currently to enable or disable the SRR capability on the VM we need to have
the VM in shutoff state. We should be able to toggle this field dynamically
so that the shutdown of a VM is not needed.

Change-Id: I9453b6c3cf6bfa13e3855a72ca36c79f5993ef2d

commit_message:
Workaround for LP#1641568

If a server performs a very slow operations with network devices,
libvirt can raise an exception when destroy a domain, see [1].
However, domain is actually destroyed.

Make a workaround to continue with other domains.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1641568

Change-Id: Id9e259d7038f4f7a4d60e0b200d4e32a545b788d

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I165921ca1053041104c915bf0d3f567e6f5c09eb

In OVS version 2.5.1 there are several bug fixes to issues that Neutron

Specifically, for bug 1640283, we need the following commit from OVS:
8c0b419a0b9ac0141d6973dcc80306dfc6a83d31 ofproto/trace: Fix "unchanged"
output for Final flow

(cherry picked from commit 7403bccbc351d53bbc31d6ba8017e68c754f93fd)

commit_message:
Install OVS from git if current version < 2.5.1

In OVS version 2.5.1 there are several bug fixes to issues that Neutron
encounters. This fix allows devstack to install a newer version of OVS,
by default version 2.5.1.

Specifically, for bug 1640283, we need the following commit from OVS:
8c0b419a0b9ac0141d6973dcc80306dfc6a83d31 ofproto/trace: Fix "unchanged"
output for Final flow

The version is overridable by NEUTRON_OVERRIDE_OVS_BRANCH variable.

Change-Id: Icc9d9811e6fc1935966241ed499c5e597a675877
Related-Bug: 1602567
Closes-Bug: 1640283
(cherry picked from commit 7403bccbc351d53bbc31d6ba8017e68c754f93fd)

subject: Remove the generic eventlet monkey patch from test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 10:11:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Remove the generic eventlet monkey patch from test

ironic-inspector tempest plugin caused unexplained ssh
issues to tempest due to the eventlet monkey patch.

Tempest does not uses eventlet and will not,
and a late monkey patch just causes strange issues.

Looks like safe to simply remove it from the __init__.py,
the monkey happens in the right time when needed,
even without this part.

Change-Id: I2595277105236c371fdb76532f66ef2af3dddeb6
(cherry picked from commit 59cf107e17728e082236d79ff178bae1c140e718)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the generic eventlet monkey patch from test

ironic-inspector tempest plugin caused unexplained ssh
issues to tempest due to the eventlet monkey patch.

Tempest does not uses eventlet and will not,
and a late monkey patch just causes strange issues.

Looks like safe to simply remove it from the __init__.py,
the monkey happens in the right time when needed,
even without this part.

Change-Id: I2595277105236c371fdb76532f66ef2af3dddeb6
(cherry picked from commit 59cf107e17728e082236d79ff178bae1c140e718)

commit_message:
Fix "failed unplugging ha interface" error when deleting router

Deleting router namespaces happens before deleting router ha interface.
So it will fail when deleting router ha interface. The change
is to remove router ha interface before deleting router namespace.

Change-Id: I3d936701c9dac7671f12e1966449662988a0f26a
Closes-Bug: #1629159
Related-Bug: #1488730
(cherry picked from commit bc03048134f12df47e1e619d21ba394db9c52dc1)

subject: Replace 'assertEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNone(...)'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 07:28:44.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_authv1.py'], 'message': "Replace 'assertEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNone(...)'

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

More details, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: Icd268b96dea5e5bb9bd344f597dfcd9cc82253f0
"}]
commit_message:
Replace 'assertEqual(None, ...)' with 'assertIsNone(...)'

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

More details, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: Icd268b96dea5e5bb9bd344f597dfcd9cc82253f0

commit_message:
Fix "failed unplugging ha interface" error when deleting router

Deleting router namespaces happens before deleting router ha interface.
So it will fail when deleting router ha interface. The change
is to remove router ha interface before deleting router namespace.

Change-Id: I3d936701c9dac7671f12e1966449662988a0f26a
Closes-Bug: #1629159
Related-Bug: #1488730
(cherry picked from commit bc03048134f12df47e1e619d21ba394db9c52dc1)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-17 23:33:11.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/ring/builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_builder.py'], 'message': 'Avoid infinite loop while placing parts

Previously, we could over-assign how many parts should be in a tier.
This would cause the local `parts` variable to go negative, which meant
that our `while parts` loop would never terminate.

Change-Id: Id7e7889742ca37cf1a9c0d55fba78d967e90e8d0
Closes-Bug: 1642538
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid infinite loop while placing parts

Previously, we could over-assign how many parts should be in a tier.
This would cause the local `parts` variable to go negative, which meant
that our `while parts` loop would never terminate.

Change-Id: Id7e7889742ca37cf1a9c0d55fba78d967e90e8d0
Closes-Bug: 1642538

subject: Modify variable's using method in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 03:21:02.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/api/app.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I737ca1d701402997262af2725e4f55d62f4abc20
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I737ca1d701402997262af2725e4f55d62f4abc20

commit_message:
Migrate libvirt volumes

This spec proposes using built-in libvirt volume transfer
methods to transfer libvirt volumes between compute nodes,
in order to facilitate cold migrations and resizes.

Spec for blueprint migrate-libvirt-volumes

Change-Id: Ia20e02fd78672baa028428da5ff730a3bb3944e0

subject: Remove the generic eventlet monkey patch from test
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-18 09:38:12.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Remove the generic eventlet monkey patch from test

ironic-inspector tempest plugin caused unexplained ssh
issues to tempest due to the eventlet monkey patch.

Tempest does not uses eventlet and will not,
and a late monkey patch just causes strange issues.

Looks like safe to simply remove it from the __init__.py,
the monkey happens in the right time when needed,
even without this part.

Change-Id: I2595277105236c371fdb76532f66ef2af3dddeb6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the generic eventlet monkey patch from test

ironic-inspector tempest plugin caused unexplained ssh
issues to tempest due to the eventlet monkey patch.

Tempest does not uses eventlet and will not,
and a late monkey patch just causes strange issues.

Looks like safe to simply remove it from the __init__.py,
the monkey happens in the right time when needed,
even without this part.

Change-Id: I2595277105236c371fdb76532f66ef2af3dddeb6

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7173, 'name': 'Scott DAngelo', 'email': 'scott.dangelo@gmail.com', 'username': 'scottda'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10058, 'name': 'Erlon R. Cruz', 'email': 'erlon.rodrigues.cruz@canonical.com', 'username': 'sombrafam'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 13144, 'name': 'Oracle ZFSSA CI', 'username': 'oracle-zfssa-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15831, 'name': 'Infortrend CI', 'email': 'ryan.chiang@infortrend.com', 'username': 'InfortrendCI'}, {'_account_id': 16269, 'name': 'Hitachi HBSD CI', 'email': 'OpenStackCI@hds.com', 'username': 'hitachi-hbsd-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 06:55:42.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/vmware/test_vmware_vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/vmdk.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/volumeops.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/vmware/test_vmware_volumeops.py'], 'message': 'VMware:Remove redundant check for usable ESX hosts

Commit 12afec15f265e0c3abf681a6c295987017dab779 added the logic to
filter out ESX hosts which are disconnected or in-maintenance mode
while selecting datastores for creating volumes. Therefore, the
check to filter out unusable ESX hosts before calling the method
to select datastores is redundant. This patch removes the redundant
check.

Partial-bug: #1556902
Change-Id: Ia3869e9f8a3fa0e5335aa872db0db5d0b2de8ac4
'}]
commit_message:
VMware:Remove redundant check for usable ESX hosts

Commit 12afec15f265e0c3abf681a6c295987017dab779 added the logic to
filter out ESX hosts which are disconnected or in-maintenance mode
while selecting datastores for creating volumes. Therefore, the
check to filter out unusable ESX hosts before calling the method
to select datastores is redundant. This patch removes the redundant
check.

Partial-bug: #1556902
Change-Id: Ia3869e9f8a3fa0e5335aa872db0db5d0b2de8ac4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-20 16:13:35.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/test_kuryr.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Implement delete endpoint

In kuryr-libnetwork, we did nothing when receiving DeleteEndpoint
request from libnetwork.
Here are two situations: port still exists or had been deleted.
If port still exists, we should delete the port.

Change-Id: I9238e4d0baf970a5e55516a367d4983522a84527
Closes-Bug: #1620887
'}]
commit_message:
Implement delete endpoint

In kuryr-libnetwork, we did nothing when receiving DeleteEndpoint
request from libnetwork.
Here are two situations: port still exists or had been deleted.
If port still exists, we should delete the port.

Change-Id: I9238e4d0baf970a5e55516a367d4983522a84527
Closes-Bug: #1620887

commit_message:
Add sort key "cluster_id" for event list

The output of event list cannot sort by cluster,
we add "cluster_id" into its sort key arrry at engine side,
both sdk and api side has support it already.

Change-Id: I6526214db99535817804b49b804cda19e127b5a2
Closed-Bug: 1642833

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 10:15:09.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-dib-image/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Create new fact for dib_env_vars

When joining DIB_RELEASE in dib_env_vars, it was not picking
the new value properly, still relying on previously registered
fact before merge. Use a different fact name, to ensure that
the whole env values are picked properly.

Change-Id: Ic1a9a7a00943792fafb16892b3b3a6fe9d3c0d54
'}]
commit_message:
Create new fact for dib_env_vars

When joining DIB_RELEASE in dib_env_vars, it was not picking
the new value properly, still relying on previously registered
fact before merge. Use a different fact name, to ensure that
the whole env values are picked properly.

Change-Id: Ic1a9a7a00943792fafb16892b3b3a6fe9d3c0d54

subject: Set trusts_delegated_roles to [] in engine.pp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 08:02:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/engine.pp'], 'message': 'Set trusts_delegated_roles to [] in engine.pp

Configure $trusts_delegated_roles to ['heat_stack_owner']
would get an error message from cli and 400 with API.

The default value of "trusts_delegated_roles" option
in heat.conf is changed to [] in Kilo.

Change-Id: I2c8e03903bc92c2fd8f8c8d06d2f59d7b5311e63
Closes-Bug: #1634361
'}]
commit_message:
Set trusts_delegated_roles to [] in engine.pp

Configure $trusts_delegated_roles to ['heat_stack_owner']
would get an error message from cli and 400 with API.

The default value of "trusts_delegated_roles" option
in heat.conf is changed to [] in Kilo.

Change-Id: I2c8e03903bc92c2fd8f8c8d06d2f59d7b5311e63
Closes-Bug: #1634361

subject: Fix missing libvirt python module in ceilometer-compute (v2)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 17:21:22.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ceilometer/ceilometer-compute/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Fix missing libvirt python module in ceilometer-compute (v2)

In debian/ubuntu based containers, package 'python-libvirt' must be installed
in order to get rid of this ERROR:

    ceilometer.agent.manager ExtensionLoadError: No module named libvirt

Change-Id: I41aae5e7e16d40a2b4ab8fb1b0657b436163896c
Closes-Bug: #1642640
"}]
commit_message:
Fix missing libvirt python module in ceilometer-compute (v2)

In debian/ubuntu based containers, package 'python-libvirt' must be installed
in order to get rid of this ERROR:

    ceilometer.agent.manager ExtensionLoadError: No module named libvirt

Change-Id: I41aae5e7e16d40a2b4ab8fb1b0657b436163896c
Closes-Bug: #1642640

commit_message:
Do not remove server_groups from default_quota_set

server_groups and server_group_members are removed from
default_quota_set temporarily, and now Nova's client
already supports these two items, so there is no need
to skip them now.

http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/update-quotas-detail

Change-Id: I64996f6ec5153a68dd25fa2d5a7b66eaa245bfd3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 06:39:07.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/heat.yaml'], 'message': "Remove neutron-vpnaas plugin from heat jobs

vpnaas is no longer part of neutron governace and openswan
(required for the reference implementation) package is not
available on ubuntu xenial.

We don't have any vpnaas integration tests in heat. So this
can be removed.

Change-Id: I7400d882c5d1e0efe49d49a982e82abdcdecdcfe
"}]
commit_message:
Remove neutron-vpnaas plugin from heat jobs

vpnaas is no longer part of neutron governace and openswan
(required for the reference implementation) package is not
available on ubuntu xenial.

We don't have any vpnaas integration tests in heat. So this
can be removed.

Change-Id: I7400d882c5d1e0efe49d49a982e82abdcdecdcfe

commit_message:

uuids for consistency.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-24 11:41:41.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/elastic.py'], 'message': "Process stats from ElasticSearch matched by IP

In some scenarios ElasticSearch returns its IP address
as 'host' value. This was filtered out when looking for
matching hostname. This commit adds IP address to
allowed 'hostnames'

Change-Id: I3fd1adf291c2eead0c8c601140a5e4b1487ba9a4
"}]
commit_message:
Process stats from ElasticSearch matched by IP

In some scenarios ElasticSearch returns its IP address
as 'host' value. This was filtered out when looking for
matching hostname. This commit adds IP address to
allowed 'hostnames'

Change-Id: I3fd1adf291c2eead0c8c601140a5e4b1487ba9a4

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

As of now, UUID is being generated using either uuid.uuid4()
or uuidutils.generate_uuid(). In order to maintain consistency,
we propose to use uuidutils.generate_uuid() from oslo_utils.

Change-Id: I233003f3b62f0c6700ae204fec98779c1508fe0d
Closes-bug: #1082248

Change-Id: I5e5dd726375ddc9842e605dba458d579d472aefe

commit_message:
Make source build gates voting

Introduce voting build gates as commits to Kolla will be less
frequent and we need to ensure higher stability of these.

Change-Id: I5e5dd726375ddc9842e605dba458d579d472aefe

commit_message:
Adds deploy guide gate jobs

Move the run-deploy-guide.sh file as include file into JJB so that the
script is not baked into our images anymore.

For the deploy guide gate jobs, follow the project install-guide setup
on adding these.

Change-Id: Ibffee0b4b356968029590c8e3abd672f0e082e69

commit_message:
Make monasca-transform check non-voting

The code at this stage needs quite a bit of work to
render the unit tests compliant with the tox environment.
In order to allow patches to merge it is necessary to relax
the check and gate until remedial work can be merged.

Change-Id: Ib469fdb4a5b410a75aee2b9c476817d12858a3e2

revisions:

This is an initial attempt at supporting multiple regions.  It should
handle the mechanics of deploying an instance/volume to a remote

Co-Authored-By: Doug Shelley <doug@tesora.com>
Depends-On: I386efb2d5c147417af7ea25704405977c9b6bbcd

commit_message:
Multi-Region Support

This is an initial attempt at supporting multiple regions.  It should
handle the mechanics of deploying an instance/volume to a remote
region.  Additional changes may be required to allow the guest
agent on the instance to connect back to the originating region.

Co-Authored-By: Doug Shelley <doug@tesora.com>
Depends-On: I386efb2d5c147417af7ea25704405977c9b6bbcd
Change-Id: Ib0b35100c0780dc07c60d20622554ba77c4bc850

subject: Get python-troveclient to use upper-constraints.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-17 03:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Get python-troveclient to use upper-constraints.txt

In review[1] which passed just fine in check some days ago failed in
gate today. This is because the current tox environment uses requests
v2.12.1 which appears to not work and is beyond the value in
upper-constraints.txt. As observed in [2] we need
upper-constraints.txt in python-troveclient.

But since python-troveclient is itself listed in upper-constraints.txt
you can't just stick it in tox.ini and expect good things to happen.

I'm adding a co-author to this change based on [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382493/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398339/

Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: I386efb2d5c147417af7ea25704405977c9b6bbcd
"}]
commit_message:
Get python-troveclient to use upper-constraints.txt

In review[1] which passed just fine in check some days ago failed in
gate today. This is because the current tox environment uses requests
v2.12.1 which appears to not work and is beyond the value in
upper-constraints.txt. As observed in [2] we need
upper-constraints.txt in python-troveclient.

But since python-troveclient is itself listed in upper-constraints.txt
you can't just stick it in tox.ini and expect good things to happen.

I'm adding a co-author to this change based on [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382493/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398339/

Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: I386efb2d5c147417af7ea25704405977c9b6bbcd

subject: Allow 'size' and 'from' as search parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-20 15:54:18.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/elasticsearch/__init__.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/v1/test_search.py', 'doc/source/searchlightapi.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1568923-add-size-from-4dd681d72bc0ef6c.yaml', 'searchlight/api/v1/search.py'], 'message': "Allow 'size' and 'from' as search parameters

For some reason I can't remember, we used 'limit' and 'offset' for
paging parameters. Elasticsearch uses 'size' and 'from'. This patch
adds 'size' and 'from' as synonyms for 'limit' and 'offset'. It
disallows specifying 'size' and 'limit' together, or 'offset' and 'from'
together.

There's no objections from the API working group
(http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105840.html)
to adding 'duplicate' parameters.

Change-Id: Ice32176826291ba7607d31aa65925a7f911aab29
Closes-Bug: #1568923
"}]
commit_message:
Allow 'size' and 'from' as search parameters

For some reason I can't remember, we used 'limit' and 'offset' for
paging parameters. Elasticsearch uses 'size' and 'from'. This patch
adds 'size' and 'from' as synonyms for 'limit' and 'offset'. It
disallows specifying 'size' and 'limit' together, or 'offset' and 'from'
together.

There's no objections from the API working group
(http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105840.html)
to adding 'duplicate' parameters.

Change-Id: Ice32176826291ba7607d31aa65925a7f911aab29
Closes-Bug: #1568923

commit_message:
Use call_and_ignore_notfound_exc to cleanup floating-ip-bulk

The _delete_floating_ips_bulk in FloatingIPsBulkAdminTestJSON
should only ignore the exception silently when the exception type is
NotFound, so here we can just use test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc.

Change-Id: I2e3c4e30650b22a1b20497d26842414126ce6b25

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I1e3cd43862bfa727f7f54037f4d504707d02dc86

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

Trivial fix

Change-Id: I5b6ac7d99f0689843eb98cb3e9b9b10531322640
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

Trivial fix

Change-Id: I5b6ac7d99f0689843eb98cb3e9b9b10531322640

commit_message:
Add detail API to quota-set API collection

Currently the quota-set API only returns single attribute
'limit'. This change intends to add a new API
'quota-sets/{project_id}/detail' to retrieve more info
with attributes 'in_use', 'limit', 'reserved'.

APIImpact
Partially implements: blueprint admin-check-tenant-quota-usage

Change-Id: I9c701b642a1f5d6e2ecffba5f7c2f72bf0fc7fd6

subject: Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 03:37:38.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/swarm/fragments/make-cert.py'], 'message': 'Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

TrivialFix: Similar [1] in Kolla project
As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.
Therefore, when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349353/

Change-Id: Iad395100505c70da11c825ff8f3f5787db07ca44
'}]
commit_message:
Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

TrivialFix: Similar [1] in Kolla project
As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.
Therefore, when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349353/

Change-Id: Iad395100505c70da11c825ff8f3f5787db07ca44

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-12 11:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Add bindep environment to tox

This is helpful for listing any missing system requirements [1].
And also add skipsdist/usedevelop to tox to ensure that barbican
is installed into virtualenv using 'python setup.py develop' instead
of creating a sdist everytime, the latter may lead to performance issue.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements

Change-Id: I7570ac7ec4686e347d0e11294e94fc6404a71169
"}]
commit_message:
Add bindep environment to tox

This is helpful for listing any missing system requirements [1].
And also add skipsdist/usedevelop to tox to ensure that barbican
is installed into virtualenv using 'python setup.py develop' instead
of creating a sdist everytime, the latter may lead to performance issue.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements

Change-Id: I7570ac7ec4686e347d0e11294e94fc6404a71169

We should be using OVO instances as much as possible in the volume
manager's code, but we still have some instances of ORM instances being
passed to drivers.

This patch fixes only 1 specific case, so there are more cases still
pending to change to OVOs, which is the call from the
copy_volume_to_image method in the manager to the respective driver

Closes-Bug: #1641611
Change-Id: If30d3521d3a28488b12ed3bd4c753066b80d39c9
"}]
commit_message:
Pass OVO instance to copy_volume_to_image

We should be using OVO instances as much as possible in the volume
manager's code, but we still have some instances of ORM instances being
passed to drivers.

This patch fixes only 1 specific case, so there are more cases still
pending to change to OVOs, which is the call from the
copy_volume_to_image method in the manager to the respective driver
method.

Closes-Bug: #1641611
Change-Id: If30d3521d3a28488b12ed3bd4c753066b80d39c9

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-07 18:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/util/filters/filters.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/images.module.js', 'horizon/static/framework/util/filters/filters.js'], 'message': "In Images Overview, dates should be properly formatted

We should apply date filters on created_at and updated_at
for readability.

Angular's dateFilter (https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/filter/date)
does not take into account browser locale or timezone,
so we use javascript's Date() where we can pass in
locale information.

Updated simpleDateFilter to account for locale information
using settings.py's languageCode.

Change-Id: I2948785ced73b38fad0024e138be28e9b07a44dc
"}]
commit_message:
In Images Overview, dates should be properly formatted

We should apply date filters on created_at and updated_at
for readability.

Angular's dateFilter (https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/filter/date)
does not take into account browser locale or timezone,
so we use javascript's Date() where we can pass in
locale information.

Updated simpleDateFilter to account for locale information
using settings.py's languageCode.

Change-Id: I2948785ced73b38fad0024e138be28e9b07a44dc

Host level replication capability was added to the NetApp
cDOT Block and File drivers through

However, volumes created on these backends did not

Closes-Bug: #1622057
(cherry picked from commit df284e68f9f00282b05eb523e4ee3d5f63b8a750)

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT: Fix model update for cheesecake volumes

Host level replication capability was added to the NetApp
cDOT Block and File drivers through
I87b92e76d0d5022e9be610b9e237b89417309c05.
However, volumes created on these backends did not
have the 'replication_status' field set.

Fix this by returning model updates to the volume manager.

Change-Id: If1d24e87413e2c829bc5a701293fb3be67412155
Closes-Bug: #1622057
(cherry picked from commit df284e68f9f00282b05eb523e4ee3d5f63b8a750)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary requestor info

requestor_name/requestor_email/requestor_phone are unnecessary info
when running functional test. And when an order with these meta are
created in barbican, retrieving order will fail.

Change-Id: I37c1616ba434f041657cc0ce63a0ff5112c2cd33
Closes-Bug: #1635966

commit_message:
Late allocation of IPs during VIF binding

Propose that VIF binding only expect an IP address at the last
moment, giving Neutron the option of choosing it based on location.

Change-Id: Icd97ded28b7b6500a1c3745c6e7aa782f86747b3

allow it's vlan tag to be exposed through a device metadata to the guests.

Implements blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port-vlan
Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Expose SR-IOV physical function's VLAN tag to guests

As SR-IOV physical functions can not be assigned with a VLAN tag,
allow it's vlan tag to be exposed through a device metadata to the guests.

Implements blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port-vlan
Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9d0f4dcb0f52582704555724f4a29684896f4178

commit_message:
Reload backend driver after updated pool

After updating the pool's option, the backend driver behind
pool should be reload to take these new options.

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>
Closes-Bug: #1387441

Change-Id: Ib0cbabf86a3155094e7d634276821b0f933b8b2c

subject: Update local.sh sample file to use OSC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 11:49:54.000000000', 'files': ['samples/local.sh'], 'message': "Update local.sh sample file to use OSC

Besides updating to OSC CLI, this patch also fixes an argument name typo
present before in 'nova keypair-add' (--pub_key should be --pub-key).

Specifying $OS_PROJECT_NAME in case user is associated to multiple
projects containing security groups with same name (e.g. 'default').

Change-Id: I776f6edfc4c6c798a39d3260827a18c695f05c87
(cherry picked from commit bac2e4ddc28393fbd3c6f45248737893b5d0fd97)
"}]
commit_message:
Update local.sh sample file to use OSC

Besides updating to OSC CLI, this patch also fixes an argument name typo
present before in 'nova keypair-add' (--pub_key should be --pub-key).

Specifying $OS_PROJECT_NAME in case user is associated to multiple
projects containing security groups with same name (e.g. 'default').

Change-Id: I776f6edfc4c6c798a39d3260827a18c695f05c87
(cherry picked from commit bac2e4ddc28393fbd3c6f45248737893b5d0fd97)

commit_message:

subject: Fix KeyError when auditor finds an expired object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 18:52:21.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'swift/obj/auditor.py'], 'message': 'Fix KeyError when auditor finds an expired object

Since the related change [1] the auditor checks deleted objects in
case their tombstone is ready to be reclaimed. However, the auditor
mistakes an expired object for a deleted object because
DiskFileExpired is a subclass of DiskFileDeleted. This causes a
KeyError to be raised and logged because the expired object has no
tombstone info in the ondisk_info data structure.

This patch makes the auditor catch and ignore DiskFileExpired
exceptions before handling DiskFileDeleted exceptions.

[1] Related-Change: I3e99dc702d55a7424c6482969e03cb4afac854a4

Change-Id: I9872b6997d09dcfd8a868c4b91b9379407283b8e
Closes-Bug: #1638016
(cherry picked from commit a4d77d918d99dfa8a1e7f1b0561769a17ba64932)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError when auditor finds an expired object

Since the related change [1] the auditor checks deleted objects in
case their tombstone is ready to be reclaimed. However, the auditor
mistakes an expired object for a deleted object because
DiskFileExpired is a subclass of DiskFileDeleted. This causes a
KeyError to be raised and logged because the expired object has no
tombstone info in the ondisk_info data structure.

This patch makes the auditor catch and ignore DiskFileExpired
exceptions before handling DiskFileDeleted exceptions.

[1] Related-Change: I3e99dc702d55a7424c6482969e03cb4afac854a4

Change-Id: I9872b6997d09dcfd8a868c4b91b9379407283b8e
Closes-Bug: #1638016
(cherry picked from commit a4d77d918d99dfa8a1e7f1b0561769a17ba64932)

commit_message:
(WIP)Docker auth plugin to prevent deletion of infra containers

Magnum creates couple of infrastructure containers(swarm-manager,
swarm-agent) as part of swarm cluster creation. This patch is to
prevent accidental deletion of these infra containers.
This change assumes that docker authorization plugin is built and
uploaded to a publicly accessible URL.

Change-Id: I7aaab91944c97cebbd22eb4a8bc564dcd0c97317
Implements: blueprint docker-authz-plugin

subject: SLO: Concurrently HEAD segments
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 9216, 'name': 'Joel Wright', 'email': 'joel.wright@gmail.com', 'username': 'jjw-sohonet'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-16 20:13:11.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample'], 'message': "SLO: Concurrently HEAD segments

Before creating a static large object, we must verify that all of the
referenced segments exist. Previously, this was done sequentially; due
to latency between proxy and object nodes, clients must be careful to
either keep their segment count low or use very long (minute+) timeouts.
We mitigate this somewhat by enforcing a hard limit on segment count,
but even then, HEADing a thousand segments (the default limit) with an
average latency of (say) 100ms will require more than a minute and a
half.

Further, the nested-SLO approach requires multiple requests from the
client -- as a result, Swift3 is in the position of enforcing a lower
limit than S3's 10,000 (which will break some clients) or requiring that
clients have timeouts on the order of 15-20 minutes (!).

Now, we'll perform the segment HEADs in parallel, with a concurrency
factor set by the operator. This is very similar to (and builds upon)
the parallel-bulk-delete work. By default, two HEAD requests will be
allowed at a time.

As a side-effect, we'll also only ever HEAD a path once per manifest.
Previously, if a manifest alternated between two paths repeatedly (for
instance, because the user wanted to splice together various ranges from
two sub-SLOs), then each entry in the manifest would trigger a fresh
HEAD request.

Upgrade Consideration
=====================
If operators would like to preserve the prior (single-threaded) SLO
creation behavior, they must add the following line to their
[filter:slo] proxy config section:

   concurrency = 1

This may be done prior to upgrading Swift.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1637133
Related-Change: I128374d74a4cef7a479b221fd15eec785cc4694a
Change-Id: I567949567ecdbd94fa06d1dd5d3cdab0d97207b6
"}]
commit_message:
SLO: Concurrently HEAD segments

Before creating a static large object, we must verify that all of the
referenced segments exist. Previously, this was done sequentially; due
to latency between proxy and object nodes, clients must be careful to
either keep their segment count low or use very long (minute+) timeouts.
We mitigate this somewhat by enforcing a hard limit on segment count,
but even then, HEADing a thousand segments (the default limit) with an
average latency of (say) 100ms will require more than a minute and a
half.

Further, the nested-SLO approach requires multiple requests from the
client -- as a result, Swift3 is in the position of enforcing a lower
limit than S3's 10,000 (which will break some clients) or requiring that
clients have timeouts on the order of 15-20 minutes (!).

Now, we'll perform the segment HEADs in parallel, with a concurrency
factor set by the operator. This is very similar to (and builds upon)
the parallel-bulk-delete work. By default, two HEAD requests will be
allowed at a time.

As a side-effect, we'll also only ever HEAD a path once per manifest.
Previously, if a manifest alternated between two paths repeatedly (for
instance, because the user wanted to splice together various ranges from
two sub-SLOs), then each entry in the manifest would trigger a fresh
HEAD request.

Upgrade Consideration
=====================
If operators would like to preserve the prior (single-threaded) SLO
creation behavior, they must add the following line to their
[filter:slo] proxy config section:

   concurrency = 1

This may be done prior to upgrading Swift.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1637133
Related-Change: I128374d74a4cef7a479b221fd15eec785cc4694a

commit_message:
Properly read MySQL/MariaDB configuration file

Existing code didn't work well, as it could read options
from sections which were after the [client] section
(client_section variable was never set back to False).

Also used six to make this work for Python2 and Python3

Change-Id: Icd7339e561d08492ccede97defc53f906c072abf

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-16 02:05:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3'], 'message': 'Stop setting route pointing back to tenant router

This removes the logic to add a route pointing to the IPv4
tenant private network range since the router is performing
SNAT. If reaching the IPs via the route worked at all, it was

by Neutron.

Change-Id: If45e3fc15c050cfbac11b57c1eaf137dd7ed816f

commit_message:
Stop setting route pointing back to tenant router

This removes the logic to add a route pointing to the IPv4
tenant private network range since the router is performing
SNAT. If reaching the IPs via the route worked at all, it was
by accident since this behavior is certainly not guaranteed
by Neutron.

Change-Id: If45e3fc15c050cfbac11b57c1eaf137dd7ed816f

commit_message:
Files with no code must be left completely empty

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:

[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I99eeccb0d13da441ff8ffe8869889e6f2559c49f

subject: Fix using filter() to meet python2,3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-26 10:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/safe_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix using filter() to meet python2,3

As mentioned in link[1], if we need filter() on python3,
Raplace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
TrivialFix.

Change-Id: If076b3572c3196fc85fe4652a02d9496caff443b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix using filter() to meet python2,3

As mentioned in link[1], if we need filter() on python3,
Raplace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
TrivialFix.

Change-Id: If076b3572c3196fc85fe4652a02d9496caff443b

commit_message:
Make n-net refuse to start unless using CellsV1

At the Barcenlona summit, we discussed disabling n-net everywhere as a
precursor to removal. The only exception for using n-net is as required
for CellsV1 users, which require it as the only out-of-the-box supported
networking option.

We will remove this check and n-net entirely when those users have a
migration path to neutron and cellsv2.

Depends-On: I47f72eac6a7657bf44319fa5d2df18ce62827f6f

Change-Id: I7309afa5230bcaeeeddb554d95c327d3a614ae6e

WIP: Bake container agent image into Atomic image
  - Image to test with: https://test-fedora-23-ironic-image.web.cern.ch/test-fedora-23-ironic-image/fedora-atomic-23-drago.qcow2

This patch adds support for cluster lifecycle operations, starting with
the restart operation. The restart action restarts the COE services on
the master and worker nodes. The endpoint does not accept a request
body and responds with a 204 with no response body. The endpoint is:

PATCH /clusters/{id}/actions/restart

Cluster lifecycle operations that deal with software on a node (such as
restart) use a containerized version of the software config agent
(os-collect-config and friends) that can poll Heat to receive
software updates.

Change-Id: I4f5a9f01726fa28dde6a1be7bdce5f79a31e8045
Depends-On: I2ff7fdcd75d9700c0584a12c3f01a509e4b5725e

Partially-Implements: blueprint cluster-restart-operation
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Cluster restart lifecycle operation for k8s

WIP: Bake container agent image into Atomic image
  - Image to test with: https://test-fedora-23-ironic-image.web.cern.ch/test-fedora-23-ironic-image/fedora-atomic-23-drago.qcow2

This patch adds support for cluster lifecycle operations, starting with
the restart operation. The restart action restarts the COE services on
the master and worker nodes. The endpoint does not accept a request
body and responds with a 204 with no response body. The endpoint is:

PATCH /clusters/{id}/actions/restart

Cluster lifecycle operations that deal with software on a node (such as
restart) use a containerized version of the software config agent
(os-collect-config and friends) that can poll Heat to receive
software updates.

Change-Id: I4f5a9f01726fa28dde6a1be7bdce5f79a31e8045
Depends-On: I2ff7fdcd75d9700c0584a12c3f01a509e4b5725e
Depends-On: Ia49a549e11e2e6a1e9399a1370f990780c17bf0d
Depends-on: I9f44803cf04b572074bdb4b97ee58827c5611514
Partially-Implements: blueprint cluster-restart-operation
