subject: Templates and scripts for Kuryr
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-12 19:54:27.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/cluster.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/fragments/network-service.sh', 'magnum/drivers/swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/swarmnode.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/swarmmaster.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/fragments/write-heat-params-node.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/fragments/write-heat-params-master.yaml'], 'message': 'Templates and scripts for Kuryr

Libnetwork support in Swarm Fedora Atomic driver

Update the templates and scripts for Swarm Fedora Atomic
to support the option --network-driver=kuryr.  The script for
Kuryr creates the necessary Neutron config files and systemd
services to start up two containers:  the Openvswitch
container and the Kuryr container.  The OpenVswitch
container runs the Openvswitch service and Neutron L2
agent for Openvswitch.  The Kuryr container runs the
Kuryr libnetwork service to respond to request from
Docker.

This integration works with the Mitaka version of Kuryr
libnetwork.  The new refactored Kuryr driver is not yet
ready, so some re-work may be necessary whene it will be
ready.  No functional difference is expected between the
Mitaka and Newton version of the libnetwork driver.

This patch covers the templates and the scripts.
Follow-on patches will add the config parameters and
enable the driver.

Partially implements: blueprint kuryr-swarm-integration
Change-Id: I81f60f522753fda204d5f8006868872a0d9e8adf
'}]
commit_message:
Templates and scripts for Kuryr

Libnetwork support in Swarm Fedora Atomic driver

Update the templates and scripts for Swarm Fedora Atomic
to support the option --network-driver=kuryr.  The script for
Kuryr creates the necessary Neutron config files and systemd
services to start up two containers:  the Openvswitch
container and the Kuryr container.  The OpenVswitch
container runs the Openvswitch service and Neutron L2
agent for Openvswitch.  The Kuryr container runs the
Kuryr libnetwork service to respond to request from
Docker.

This integration works with the Mitaka version of Kuryr
libnetwork.  The new refactored Kuryr driver is not yet
ready, so some re-work may be necessary whene it will be
ready.  No functional difference is expected between the
Mitaka and Newton version of the libnetwork driver.

This patch covers the templates and the scripts.
Follow-on patches will add the config parameters and
enable the driver.

Partially implements: blueprint kuryr-swarm-integration
Change-Id: I81f60f522753fda204d5f8006868872a0d9e8adf

commit_message:
Config parameters for Kuryr

as the network driver for Swarm.
The current parameters are for the Mitaka version of Kuryr
and they are expected to be changed soon in the refactored
version in Newton.

This patch is for testing and not intended for production
use.

Partially implements: blueprint kuryr-swarm-integration
Change-Id: I79a7a262d1ff15e5b57e686bc1835088066ffb61

subject: test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-06 09:08:04.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/base.py', 'magnum/tests/policy_fixture.py'], 'message': "test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: Id04be158467ad613aca73139fa42c38772fdc883
Closes-Bug: #1517839
"}]
commit_message:
test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: Id04be158467ad613aca73139fa42c38772fdc883
Closes-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
[WIP][PoC] Add generator for API reference in OpenAPI format

**DO NOT MERGE**

This patch adds OpenAPI formatted reference generator.

Run "tox -e=openapi" command, OpenAPI JSON file will be
created in openapi directory.

**note**
pecan-swagger is customized for this patch at following
personal repo[1]. Working with original author Michael McCune,
but before merging our changes into original repo, pecan-swagger
will be installed from personal repo[1] using tox.ini.
[1] https://github.com/shu-mutou/pecan-swagger

Change-Id: I88210ac1b6b19592fbbb5ea3cc3f64afd4246cca
Implements: blueprint magnum-api-swagger-support
Co-Authored-By: OTSUKA, Yuanying <yuanying@fraction.jp>

Only magnum service list is supported in magnum. For environment

commit_message:
Allow magnum services to be deleted by admin

Only magnum service list is supported in magnum. For environment
where a HA cluster is setup, in that case node deletion and
replacement may lead to services is in down state permanently.
After node deletion or replacement this information is there,
which is actually showing wrong status. Admin must have this
functionality to delete the service and keep the enviornment
in clean state.

There are options in nova and neutron etc. but cinder does not
have this option. In our product, we delete it from database, which
is definitely not a good idea to manipulate database. Let the
service manipulate it and let it take care of dependencies.

Change-Id: I9a6d1e36406d2792fd390aa8000a4aae0bdca31b
Closes-Bug: #1607230

subject: Neutron loadbalancer uses incorrect security group
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-04 07:34:06.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/conductor/handlers/common/neutron.py', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubecluster.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/cluster.yaml', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/common/coe_ports.py', 'magnum/drivers/mesos_ubuntu_v1/templates/mesoscluster.yaml', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/bay_conductor.py'], 'message': 'Neutron loadbalancer uses incorrect security group

As per bug, when loadbalancer is created then port is also created
and default security group is attached. And i could not find any
method of attaching security group to port using heat templates.

A neutron client class has been made, which creates security group
and security rules. Then security group is attached to port for
fedora kubernetes driver.

Change-Id: Ic0c2f6d3bb52c4cf87cbb4a585d9bce50d6c9b13
Closes-Bug: #1605416
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron loadbalancer uses incorrect security group

As per bug, when loadbalancer is created then port is also created
and default security group is attached. And i could not find any
method of attaching security group to port using heat templates.

A neutron client class has been made, which creates security group
and security rules. Then security group is attached to port for
fedora kubernetes driver.

Change-Id: Ic0c2f6d3bb52c4cf87cbb4a585d9bce50d6c9b13
Closes-Bug: #1605416

subject: Closes-Bug:  #1618291 failed to delete bay in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-19 08:22:42.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/conductor/handlers/cluster_conductor.py'], 'message': 'Closes-Bug:  #1618291 failed to delete bay in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS

Failed to delete bay which is CREATE_IN_PROGRESS,
the reason is variousÔºåsuch as

Resource DELETE failed: ResourceUnknownStatus:
resource s.kube_masters.resources[0].resources.docker_volume_att ach:
Volume detachment failed - Unknown status attaching due to "Unknown"

or

Resource DELETE failed: Conflict: resources.secgroup_kube_master:
Security Group 222b9d66-3473-42c0-8408-61612498ecef in use.
Neutron server returns request_ids:
['req-fb3fce21-5613-466a- 847f-f1cf112b85ec']

commit_message:
Closes-Bug:  #1618291 failed to delete bay in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS

Failed to delete bay which is CREATE_IN_PROGRESS,
the reason is variousÔºåsuch as

Resource DELETE failed: ResourceUnknownStatus:
resource s.kube_masters.resources[0].resources.docker_volume_att ach:
Volume detachment failed - Unknown status attaching due to "Unknown"

or

Resource DELETE failed: Conflict: resources.secgroup_kube_master:
Security Group 222b9d66-3473-42c0-8408-61612498ecef in use.
Neutron server returns request_ids:
['req-fb3fce21-5613-466a- 847f-f1cf112b85ec']

Due to the bay in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS deletion operation may cause a lot
of abnormal, so don't support delete the bay in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: Ieeb23adbf205ca0da6c2f271750db1ffa86f2348

commit_message:
Using assertIsNotNone() instead of assertNotEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred
over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: Iadb27153109b2c4b92df43fc97a5e50eed86f58c

image build, but wasn't applied to the os-refresh-config script
that would run after deployment.  The same problems apply there,

subject: Cleanup yumdownloader repos
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-10 06:03:06.000000000', 'files': ['elements/yum-minimal/root.d/08-yum-chroot'], 'message': "Cleanup yumdownloader repos

yumdownloader has to have all the repo XML files, etc, which adds up
to a not totally insignificant 150MiB or so.  Currently we're leaking
this directory for every build, which adds up on regualar builders
like nodepool.

Isolate the call with a separate TMPDIR so we can clean it up after
the initial download.

Change-Id: Ic65e8ca837cc76b7a1bb9f83027b4a5bdd270f75
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup yumdownloader repos

yumdownloader has to have all the repo XML files, etc, which adds up
to a not totally insignificant 150MiB or so.  Currently we're leaking
this directory for every build, which adds up on regualar builders
like nodepool.

Isolate the call with a separate TMPDIR so we can clean it up after
the initial download.

Change-Id: Ic65e8ca837cc76b7a1bb9f83027b4a5bdd270f75

subject: lib: common-functions: Fix tmpfs umounting
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-16 15:44:46.000000000', 'files': ['lib/common-functions'], 'message': "lib: common-functions: Fix tmpfs umounting

It has been observed that some chroot operations spawn additional
processes which rely on chroot files. More specifically, zypper, uses
gpg-agent to import and validate gpg keys for its repositories. This
gpg-agent process may stay alive for longer which prevents unmounting of
the tmpfs directory since the gpg-agent process still uses libraries etc
which were present in the chroot. We try to solve this by using walking
all the pids in /proc to find out the running processes in the chroot and
kill them gracefully. If that fails for whatever reason, then we simply
keep trying to umount the tmpfs directory before we give up.

The gpg-agent process usually terminates soon after its home directory
disappears but on fast systems we can reach the 'umount tmpfs' point
before gpg-agent terminates by itself. The solution is generic enough so
other 'chroot processes' can also be handled appropriately.

Change-Id: Iccf332678c79266113e76f062884fc5ee79e515d
"}]
commit_message:
lib: common-functions: Fix tmpfs umounting

It has been observed that some chroot operations spawn additional
processes which rely on chroot files. More specifically, zypper, uses
gpg-agent to import and validate gpg keys for its repositories. This
gpg-agent process may stay alive for longer which prevents unmounting of
the tmpfs directory since the gpg-agent process still uses libraries etc
which were present in the chroot. We try to solve this by using walking
all the pids in /proc to find out the running processes in the chroot and
kill them gracefully. If that fails for whatever reason, then we simply
keep trying to umount the tmpfs directory before we give up.

The gpg-agent process usually terminates soon after its home directory
disappears but on fast systems we can reach the 'umount tmpfs' point
before gpg-agent terminates by itself. The solution is generic enough so
other 'chroot processes' can also be handled appropriately.

Change-Id: Iccf332678c79266113e76f062884fc5ee79e515d

subject: debian: install dialog package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 14:37:55.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debian/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'debian: install dialog package

Without the dialog package is not possible
to properly use an interactive frontend.

debconf will print the following errors:

debconf: unable to initialize frontend: Dialog
debconf: (No usable dialog-like program is installed,
so the dialog based frontend cannot be used. at
/usr/share/perl5/Debconf/FrontEnd/Dialog.pm line 76, <> line 1.)

Change-Id: I0c7142f717cacf7437dbac1e1696f39b00cb4c49
'}]
commit_message:
debian: install dialog package

Without the dialog package is not possible
to properly use an interactive frontend.

debconf will print the following errors:

debconf: unable to initialize frontend: Dialog
debconf: (No usable dialog-like program is installed,
so the dialog based frontend cannot be used. at
/usr/share/perl5/Debconf/FrontEnd/Dialog.pm line 76, <> line 1.)

subject: Change path for dnf arch override so basearch is not overwritten.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 18:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rpm-distro/pre-install.d/01-override-yum-arch'], 'message': "Change path for dnf arch override so basearch is not overwritten.

After writing the basearch value to /etc/dnf/vars/basearch the
arch value was overwriting the same file.  This appears to be
incorrect, so changing it to write /etc/dnf/vars/arch, which
matches the subsequent 'yum' code paths.

Change-Id: I5da54f03224c11f9e286f16b68533936c4174c2a
"}]
commit_message:
Change path for dnf arch override so basearch is not overwritten.

After writing the basearch value to /etc/dnf/vars/basearch the
arch value was overwriting the same file.  This appears to be
incorrect, so changing it to write /etc/dnf/vars/arch, which
matches the subsequent 'yum' code paths.

Change-Id: I5da54f03224c11f9e286f16b68533936c4174c2a

commit_message:
Support whole disk images in TripleO

Enable to upload whole disk images from the client,
not forcing to upload kernel and initrd images, and
not setting the parameters for those in the glance
qcow2 image.

Change-Id: I9fbac888b3e709212cc6c72153a3ca465101987c
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-full-disk-images

commit_message:
Check ceph backend connection on driver setup

Check that ceph connection really works when setting up
the driver instead of doing real connect later in init_host
phase. This mitigates the risk that the service crashes/respawns
in an infinite loop because of a connection error.

Change-Id: Ia71b55dab1535ce351310108aaf53304b15ab757
Closes-Bug: 1640169
(cherry picked from commit af79b9f5b78be5413bc363cbf12ae8351b9e4f02)

commit_message:
deprecate the entire library

the library is essentially unmaintained, no tests have been added
since it's inception 1.5 years ago.

we can move the functionality to django_openstack_auth proper
using extras, or attic the entire library if no one is using it.
either way, this is a step toward both of those outcomes.

Change-Id: I5e2cf2852e89586415ddbe8da022f7461b3ba0d6
Closes-Bug: 1584432

subject: Reinitialize venv upon install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 08:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/neutron_install.yml'], 'message': 'Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: I22dca862f88c38c15ca95b117a73f3368219b3cd
Partial-Bug: #1637509
(cherry picked from commit e7bcb312a881a0946957fcd1e3e65ca72b8952a7)
'}]
commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: I22dca862f88c38c15ca95b117a73f3368219b3cd
Partial-Bug: #1637509
(cherry picked from commit e7bcb312a881a0946957fcd1e3e65ca72b8952a7)

commit_message:
Add optional kerberos support

This commit adds support for optional kerberos based auth. It
copies the already existing django-openstack-auth plugin and
documenation at [1]. It also adds in checks to ensure the plugin
is not loaded when the library is not available.

The plugin can be optionally installed by running:

  pip install django_openstack_auth[kerberos]

Sadly there were no to copy along with the code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/django-openstack-auth-kerberos

Change-Id: I2da055834b462e24e81f38cd61d6a19b12b28a80
Closes-Bug: 1584432

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-17 13:27:28.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add freezerclient to global requirements

The python-freezerclient is a OpenStack client for Freezer.
It provides a Python API and a command-line tool (freezer).

For new Requirements Q&A:
[Q] Is the library actively maintained?
[A] Yes. You can see activity log here: http://stackalytics.com/report/activity?module=python-freezerclient&project_type=openstack&release=all

[Q] Is the library good code?
[A] Yes. OpenStack Style Guidelines is supported.

[Q] Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A] Sure. The code is tested against python 3.

[Q] Is the library license compatible?
[A] Yes, the Apache License 2.0

[Q] Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
[A] Nope.

[Q] Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
[A] No.

[Q] Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup?
[A] Yes, of course. It required for using in freezer related projects.
    BP for freezer: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/freezer/+spec/switch-to-python-freezer-client
    Gerrit Change-ID: I2627a5326c8ad4acc96177605f0250925748fb67

Change-Id: Ie108d99d56ca76614cdf6927f614a44106a0a922
'}]
commit_message:
Add freezerclient to global requirements

The python-freezerclient is a OpenStack client for Freezer.
It provides a Python API and a command-line tool (freezer).

For new Requirements Q&A:
[Q] Is the library actively maintained?
[A] Yes. You can see activity log here: http://stackalytics.com/report/activity?module=python-freezerclient&project_type=openstack&release=all

[Q] Is the library good code?
[A] Yes. OpenStack Style Guidelines is supported.

[Q] Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A] Sure. The code is tested against python 3.

[Q] Is the library license compatible?
[A] Yes, the Apache License 2.0

[Q] Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
[A] Nope.

[Q] Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
[A] No.

[Q] Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup?
[A] Yes, of course. It required for using in freezer related projects.
    BP for freezer: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/freezer/+spec/switch-to-python-freezer-client
    Gerrit Change-ID: I2627a5326c8ad4acc96177605f0250925748fb67

Change-Id: Ie108d99d56ca76614cdf6927f614a44106a0a922

commit_message:
Added support for a stop playbook in kolla

Behavior of stop playbook is very similar to the destroy
playbook.  This is meant when you may just want to bring down
the service for some sort of maintenance but not destroy all
the associated data. Also added support for the new playbook
into the kolla-ansible command.

Change-Id: Icf0ca91de71dc8ead3a024de3e5b9e49116560d1
Implements: blueprint ansible-stop-host-playbook

commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: Ib24917cf63cf0e6c7ffaf48dae15b0733b48cd04
Partial-Bug: #1637509
(cherry picked from commit 68fd798f31a8d917f38dbeb9c3d3fc5327e175bf)

commit_message:
Deleting duplicate code

devstack/lib/barbican and bin/keystone_data.sh both
contain code to setup keystone for functional tests.
There is duplicate code between them that makes
maintenance and enhancements difficult.

devstack/lib/barbican contains function named
"create_barbican_accounts" which runs the same setup
compared to bin/keystone_data.sh. Also, devstack/lib/
barbican used OpenStack client compared to
bin/keystone_data.sh which uses Keystone CLI.

There is no invocation of bin/keystone_data.sh in
barbican and hence removing dead code.

Change-Id: If9cadf2eeaa4225451cf8001f409268317b0666e
Closes-Bug: 1485837

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-09 16:10:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Update metadata proxy when subnet add/delete

With current code, if first subnet of the network is an ipv6 subnet,
the metadata proxy will not be spawned. If user then adds ipv4 subnet
with dhcp enabled, the metadata proxy will still not be spawned. As a
result, the metadata service will not be available for the network.

This patch will kill/spawn metadata proxy,  when subnet add/delete.
So, even if the first subnet of the network is not an ipv4 subnet with
dhcp enabled, the metadata proxy can still be spawned if network has
subnets need metadata proxy.

Closes-bug: #1556991

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py

Change-Id: I0b45af8f2b756732f45c13d7e2dbcd30653cc026
(cherry picked from commit 784864d1785bcd32297865cae5a7a243b05ed30d)
'}]
commit_message:
Update metadata proxy when subnet add/delete

With current code, if first subnet of the network is an ipv6 subnet,
the metadata proxy will not be spawned. If user then adds ipv4 subnet
with dhcp enabled, the metadata proxy will still not be spawned. As a
result, the metadata service will not be available for the network.

This patch will kill/spawn metadata proxy,  when subnet add/delete.
So, even if the first subnet of the network is not an ipv4 subnet with
dhcp enabled, the metadata proxy can still be spawned if network has
subnets need metadata proxy.

Closes-bug: #1556991

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py

Change-Id: I0b45af8f2b756732f45c13d7e2dbcd30653cc026
(cherry picked from commit 784864d1785bcd32297865cae5a7a243b05ed30d)

commit_message:
Remove ClusteredComputeManager

This is marked for removal in Ocata, and its continued existence
necessitates the need for the 'compute_manager' option in nova.
Simply remove this legacy code.

Change-Id: I93b62372e357db4f7c39992c244b2ec9e594ad9c
Implements: bp ironic-multiple-compute-hosts
Closes-Bug: #1464769

subject: Devmode: reposition convert and update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 00:19:24.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/convert_image.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/update_image.yml'], 'message': "Devmode: reposition convert and update

- put update after convert
  since update is made different for undercloud and overcloud images,
  having update before convert, doesn't actually update the undercloud
  image in the correct way
- up injection at the end of update
  now that update is after convert, the image injection must be launched
  at the end of update, so updated overcloud images are actually
  injected in undercloud

Change-Id: Ic7001f8bcac5b43031dee44b3b4c8093f7772db2
"}]
commit_message:
Devmode: reposition convert and update

- put update after convert
  since update is made different for undercloud and overcloud images,
  having update before convert, doesn't actually update the undercloud
  image in the correct way
- up injection at the end of update
  now that update is after convert, the image injection must be launched
  at the end of update, so updated overcloud images are actually
  injected in undercloud

Change-Id: Ic7001f8bcac5b43031dee44b3b4c8093f7772db2

commit_message:
Nova: Limit stable/newton to Trusty based grenade jobs

This is required as stable/mitaka devstack does not support Xenial and
will cause the grenade job to fail during the initial install.

Closes-bug: #1642543

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-17 17:48:19.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/ocata/os-refresh-config.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/puppet-tripleo.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/tripleo-validations.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/tripleo-heat-templates.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/os-collect-config.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/os-net-config.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/python-tripleoclient.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/os-cloud-config.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/tripleo-common.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/tripleo-puppet-elements.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/tripleo-ui.yaml', 'deliverables/ocata/tripleo-image-elements.yaml'], 'message': "Ocata-1 releases for TripleO components

This prepares initial releases for all TripleO components except
tripleo-quickstart (there is some discussion re moving this to
an independent release model as we don't have stable branches
for that because it's a bootstrapping tool, not an end user deliverable)

Note also that I've aligned the puppet-tripleo release naming with the
puppet openstack convention of a number of releases during the
cycle despite being cycle-trailing, but other tripleo components
adopt the 6.0.0.0b1 naming where we're tracking features/bugs
associated with each milestone e.g ref

https://launchpad.net/tripleo/+milestone/ocata-1

Change-Id: I890de6587efcc1ce3d93edcf8dc24e77f67b0d03
"}]
commit_message:
Ocata-1 releases for TripleO components

This prepares initial releases for all TripleO components except
tripleo-quickstart (there is some discussion re moving this to
an independent release model as we don't have stable branches
for that because it's a bootstrapping tool, not an end user deliverable)

Note also that I've aligned the puppet-tripleo release naming with the
puppet openstack convention of a number of releases during the
cycle despite being cycle-trailing, but other tripleo components
adopt the 6.0.0.0b1 naming where we're tracking features/bugs
associated with each milestone e.g ref

https://launchpad.net/tripleo/+milestone/ocata-1

Change-Id: I890de6587efcc1ce3d93edcf8dc24e77f67b0d03

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19675, 'name': 'Ben Keller', 'email': 'bjkeller@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'bjkeller'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-02-24 22:52:17.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_base.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "Headers now use a case incensitive dictionary

_prep_headers_to_info currently converts all header data to lowercase.
This fix sends all header info as a case insensitive dictionary,
HeaderKeyDict() to avoid having to normalize case.
Currently sends all headers as strings. More work may be needed
if it's better to send numbers as ints, not strings.
Fixes several unit tests that expect integers instead of strings.

Closes-Bug: 1537879

Change-Id: Iec70cb9a266820c82290ad38e5cc18a313ebc7ec
"}]
commit_message:
Headers now use a case incensitive dictionary

_prep_headers_to_info currently converts all header data to lowercase.
This fix sends all header info as a case insensitive dictionary,
HeaderKeyDict() to avoid having to normalize case.
Currently sends all headers as strings. More work may be needed
if it's better to send numbers as ints, not strings.
Fixes several unit tests that expect integers instead of strings.

Closes-Bug: 1537879

Change-Id: Iec70cb9a266820c82290ad38e5cc18a313ebc7ec

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 09:18:05.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator in following patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297487/
so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: I1bbdfdcc9c9b89ad65b91fd86a81148a3cf0d508
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator in following patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297487/
so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: I1bbdfdcc9c9b89ad65b91fd86a81148a3cf0d508

commit_message:
In disk-image-create, append to INSTALL_PACKAGES instead of clobbering.

This allows -p <packagelist> to be used multiple times.

subject: Fix pypy soabi tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-18 08:14:26.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_packaging.py'], 'message': 'Fix pypy soabi tests

Xenial PyPy adds multiarch to the compiled c library, so if PyPy reports
multiarch we add it to the soabi string.

If the installed PyPy is not configured for multiarch, the multiarch
config variable will not exist and `arch` will be None, in which case we
should only update the string if multiarch exists.

Change-Id: Idcd3af4878d5b66c6770f96e7235a7d2f848df81
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pypy soabi tests

Xenial PyPy adds multiarch to the compiled c library, so if PyPy reports
multiarch we add it to the soabi string.

If the installed PyPy is not configured for multiarch, the multiarch
config variable will not exist and `arch` will be None, in which case we
should only update the string if multiarch exists.

Change-Id: Idcd3af4878d5b66c6770f96e7235a7d2f848df81

commit_message:
Make murano-dashboard using horizon's DATABASE when horizon configured

If horizon config DATABASES, let murano-dashboard using horizon's config,
if not, will set it by murano.

Closes-bug: #1642152
Change-Id: I65c599945754b92be681058611ec9162c6606f14

commit_message:
Refactor inventory generation load/save filesystem

Segmenting the storage-related operations from the rest of the
inventory generation management tooling, in support of better
maintainability testability and future support for alternate storage
options.

Operations in manage.py are slightly updated to make use of common
code.

Change-Id: If032bcc9e4727d3895e4ef6cecb6aff511d4b0af

commit_message:
Add prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata spec

Change how we talk to neutron to allow us in the future to implement
network aware scheduling.

This is just the continuation of the work started during newton.

This is a priority, because this blocks routed networks, which is
blocking the removal of cells v1.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Change-Id: Id28509c7fae784ecc6359556a6da1bc39f2b68f7

subject: Configure AIO sources.list with first matched repo
revisions:

The bootstrap-aio role reconfigures sources.list by greping for a
pattern in the existing sources.list file. From the results of the
grep, register the base and security repos with the first stdout_line
instead of the entirety of stdout to avoid unexpected newlines and
additional repo URLs.

Closes-Bug: 1638878
Change-Id: I64e79701c3ecc62ddec5e7ed86501ca3a94d8f3d
(cherry picked from commit f9bd7ab67923c7964344e30cf736aa99cb0fd200)
'}]
commit_message:
Configure AIO sources.list with first matched repo

The bootstrap-aio role reconfigures sources.list by greping for a
pattern in the existing sources.list file. From the results of the
grep, register the base and security repos with the first stdout_line
instead of the entirety of stdout to avoid unexpected newlines and
additional repo URLs.

Closes-Bug: 1638878
Change-Id: I64e79701c3ecc62ddec5e7ed86501ca3a94d8f3d
(cherry picked from commit f9bd7ab67923c7964344e30cf736aa99cb0fd200)

subject: Don't use ssh-keygen -A for init scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-18 18:25:40.000000000', 'files': ['elements/runtime-ssh-host-keys/init-scripts/upstart/ssh-keygen.conf', 'elements/runtime-ssh-host-keys/static/usr/local/sbin/runtime-ssh-host-keys.sh', 'elements/runtime-ssh-host-keys/element-deps', 'elements/runtime-ssh-host-keys/init-scripts/systemd/ssh-keygen.service'], 'message': "Don't use ssh-keygen -A for init scripts

We are running into race conditions with glean, which ssh-keygen -A is
not handling properly.  So, create a new script to first check if the
file exists, then use 'yes' to disable overwriting of existing files.

Change-Id: Ie82e1e3f832fcc8f32c7e1335c5f0ee16d36f9a8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use ssh-keygen -A for init scripts

We are running into race conditions with glean, which ssh-keygen -A is
not handling properly.  So, create a new script to first check if the
file exists, then use 'yes' to disable overwriting of existing files.

Change-Id: Ie82e1e3f832fcc8f32c7e1335c5f0ee16d36f9a8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator in following patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297487/
so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: Ia43e287699c82e15c38f229a8e39d1a366cc506c

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-16 02:04:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Fix ML2, base db plugin update_subnet for transactions

This refactors the DB base plugin update_subnet method into
precommit and postcommit methods so a core plugin can avoid
executing the postcommit methods while it has an open
transaction. Backwards compatibility is preserved for plugins
which do not need this.

This is important because the update_subnet method in the
base plugin performs operations that shouldn't be inside
of an uncommited transaction, such as updating ports,
generating AMQP notifications, and generating AFTER_UPDATE
callback events. Until this patch, ML2 was performing the
entire base plugin update_subnet operation in a transaction.

This is also necessary for the facade and push-notification
switch because ongoing db sessions will not be used for
core methods and notification generation.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Change-Id: Ib825a9e0c0c6693a4e708ae6ce362775c70d843d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ML2, base db plugin update_subnet for transactions

This refactors the DB base plugin update_subnet method into
precommit and postcommit methods so a core plugin can avoid
executing the postcommit methods while it has an open
transaction. Backwards compatibility is preserved for plugins
which do not need this.

This is important because the update_subnet method in the
base plugin performs operations that shouldn't be inside
of an uncommited transaction, such as updating ports,
generating AMQP notifications, and generating AFTER_UPDATE
callback events. Until this patch, ML2 was performing the
entire base plugin update_subnet operation in a transaction.

This is also necessary for the facade and push-notification
switch because ongoing db sessions will not be used for
core methods and notification generation.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Change-Id: Ib825a9e0c0c6693a4e708ae6ce362775c70d843d

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-16 18:53:29.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'neutron: move xenial rally job into check queue

Since there are no visible issues with the job, and it immediately
passed on the very first experimental check in neutron master, I suggest
we just replace the existing trusty job with it, making the latter
voting without the usual time to collect statistics.

If you wonder why the job is in check queue only, it reflects the
current setup for trusty flavour.

This patch still keeps trusty job flavour for Mitaka and earlier.

Change-Id: Iecb6d063cd99257b1d5f640943c743a207fce51f
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: move xenial rally job into check queue

Since there are no visible issues with the job, and it immediately
passed on the very first experimental check in neutron master, I suggest
we just replace the existing trusty job with it, making the latter
voting without the usual time to collect statistics.

If you wonder why the job is in check queue only, it reflects the
current setup for trusty flavour.

This patch still keeps trusty job flavour for Mitaka and earlier.

Change-Id: Iecb6d063cd99257b1d5f640943c743a207fce51f

subject: return unique meter list for Resource Usage pannel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 13:36:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/ceilometer.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/ceilometer_tests.py'], 'message': "return unique meter list for Resource Usage pannel

Ceilometer list meter API will only return limited number of meters
by default to 100, and meters can have duplicate name because they may
associated to various resources. So Resource Usage pannel usually
cannot display correct meter list.

Besides, Ceilometer now supports to only return unique meter name,
without resource information, and we can get benifit from this
parameter to reduce response time and less network data.

This patch always sets unique parameter to True, which will
help to display the correct meter list. But leave limit parameter
untouched, we can add a config option in future, or just hard code
it to a very large number, in case there are many meters enabled
in user's environment.

Change-Id: I63393fcce5463fd1a69b314bd858986589c793ae
Closes-Bug: #1585532
"}]
commit_message:
return unique meter list for Resource Usage pannel

Ceilometer list meter API will only return limited number of meters
by default to 100, and meters can have duplicate name because they may
associated to various resources. So Resource Usage pannel usually
cannot display correct meter list.

Besides, Ceilometer now supports to only return unique meter name,
without resource information, and we can get benifit from this
parameter to reduce response time and less network data.

This patch always sets unique parameter to True, which will
help to display the correct meter list. But leave limit parameter
untouched, we can add a config option in future, or just hard code
it to a very large number, in case there are many meters enabled
in user's environment.

Change-Id: I63393fcce5463fd1a69b314bd858986589c793ae
Closes-Bug: #1585532

commit_message:
Add plurals management

Add functions for mapping from plural to singular and vice-versa.  This
will allow projects, including neutron and neutron-fwaas, to manage
their plurals in a common manner, rather than addressing the PLURALS
dict.

Prior to this change, PLURALS is used in extension definitons in
neutron-fwaas, neutron-lbaas, neutron-fwaas, networking-midonet,
tap-as-a-service, and neutron-dynamic-routing, among others.

Change-Id: I3f69e083afeb30f6c338e4569674edd068db3236

subject: Set a default for upper_constraints_check.status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 08:47:42.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/set-upper-constraints.yml'], 'message': "Set a default for upper_constraints_check.status

On occasion the Ansible URI module may not return
a status key, so this patch ensures that even if
it doesn't there will still be a value of '503'
which translates into a 'Service Unavailable'
error.

Change-Id: Ie944152f56bd5c68cfd80d406cf4175e9723c8f6
(cherry picked from commit 2fe22673612a983dbd9e00b9c74e5d737412987c)
"}]
commit_message:
Set a default for upper_constraints_check.status

On occasion the Ansible URI module may not return
a status key, so this patch ensures that even if
it doesn't there will still be a value of '503'
which translates into a 'Service Unavailable'
error.

Change-Id: Ie944152f56bd5c68cfd80d406cf4175e9723c8f6
(cherry picked from commit 2fe22673612a983dbd9e00b9c74e5d737412987c)

subject: WIP: Only run db setup if packages are installed
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-17 07:26:03.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': 'WIP: Only run db setup if packages are installed

Some repositories only need either MySQL or PostgreSQL as database but
our tests set up both databases and thus bindep.txt needs to contain
both databases as dependencies which might be confusing.

This change checks first whether the database programs exists and only
then sets it up. The setup will not fail.

This would also allow us to remove the python-db jobs, we could always
set up a database if the tools are installed.

WIP to start a discussion on this.

Change-Id: I765537f12075c6fabd8f6207328a7969e72c5d24
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Only run db setup if packages are installed

Some repositories only need either MySQL or PostgreSQL as database but
our tests set up both databases and thus bindep.txt needs to contain
both databases as dependencies which might be confusing.

This change checks first whether the database programs exists and only
then sets it up. The setup will not fail.

This would also allow us to remove the python-db jobs, we could always
set up a database if the tools are installed.

WIP to start a discussion on this.

Change-Id: I765537f12075c6fabd8f6207328a7969e72c5d24

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-10 11:37:49.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_share_manage.py'], 'message': "Fix share manage tempest test cleanup

test_share_manage.ManageNFSShareTest might leave undeleted shares on
backend if some tests are not run. This happens because the shares are
created and unmanaged on resource_setup and are expected to be managed
and deleted on the tests. If the tests don't run, the cleanup will not
delete the shares because they are already unmanaged, thus leaving them
created on the backend.

This patch fixes this issue by moving the share creation and unmanage
operations from resource_setup to the tests themselves.

Closes-bug: #1639848

Change-Id: I2d1790f0a323fdc7b11805842985ca5907dd23c3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix share manage tempest test cleanup

test_share_manage.ManageNFSShareTest might leave undeleted shares on
backend if some tests are not run. This happens because the shares are
created and unmanaged on resource_setup and are expected to be managed
and deleted on the tests. If the tests don't run, the cleanup will not
delete the shares because they are already unmanaged, thus leaving them
created on the backend.

This patch fixes this issue by moving the share creation and unmanage
operations from resource_setup to the tests themselves.

Closes-bug: #1639848

Change-Id: I2d1790f0a323fdc7b11805842985ca5907dd23c3

commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: Ifbe100a7052e41a2e6e4c601287749e2a8dfd0e0
Partial-Bug: #1637509
(cherry picked from commit eedc4d372413731618c4f79c2605f1f0efb2be3a)

commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: I06c58b7fee5cf5755b9490beb94c01dd7a8a3921
Partial-Bug: #1637509
(cherry picked from commit a420729b28c9794aaefc189e3f8e8dac3e8b0830)

commit_message:
Fix missing libvirt python module in ceilometer-compute (v2)

In debian/ubuntu based containers, package 'python-libvirt' must be installed
in order to get rid of this ERROR:

         ceilometer.agent.manager ExtensionLoadError: No module named libvirt

Change-Id: I870c9fa8c96b591b4b25a95e1f06411e1abca4b9
Closes-Bug: #1642640

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23330, 'name': 'Oksana Voshchana', 'email': 'anascko@gmail.com', 'username': 'Oksana'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-17 08:41:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent', 'lib/neutron', 'lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base', 'functions', 'lib/nova'], 'message': "Enable bridge firewalling if iptables are used

With the plan [1] to stop enabling it by Neutron iptables firewall
driver itself, deployment tools should catch up and enable the firewall
themselves.

This is needed for distributions that decided to disable the kernel
firewall by default (upstream kernel has it enabled). This is also
needed for distributions that ship newer kernels but don't load the
br_netfilter module before starting nova-network or Neutron iptables
firewall driver. In the latter case, firewall may not work, depending on
the order of operations executed by the driver.

To isolate devstack setups from the difference in distribution
kernel configuration and version, the following steps are done:

- we load bridge kernel module, and br_netfilter if present, to get
  access to sysctl knobs controlling the firewall;
- once knobs are available, we unconditionally set them to 1, to make
  sure the firewall is in effect.

More details at:
http://wiki.libvirt.org/page/Net.bridge.bridge-nf-call_and_sysctl.conf

[1] I9137ea017624ac92a05f73863b77f9ee4681bbe7

Change-Id: Id6bfd9595f0772a63d1096ef83ebbb6cd630fafd
Related-Bug: #1622914
"}]
commit_message:
Enable bridge firewalling if iptables are used

With the plan [1] to stop enabling it by Neutron iptables firewall
driver itself, deployment tools should catch up and enable the firewall
themselves.

This is needed for distributions that decided to disable the kernel
firewall by default (upstream kernel has it enabled). This is also
needed for distributions that ship newer kernels but don't load the
br_netfilter module before starting nova-network or Neutron iptables
firewall driver. In the latter case, firewall may not work, depending on
the order of operations executed by the driver.

To isolate devstack setups from the difference in distribution
kernel configuration and version, the following steps are done:

- we load bridge kernel module, and br_netfilter if present, to get
  access to sysctl knobs controlling the firewall;
- once knobs are available, we unconditionally set them to 1, to make
  sure the firewall is in effect.

More details at:
http://wiki.libvirt.org/page/Net.bridge.bridge-nf-call_and_sysctl.conf

[1] I9137ea017624ac92a05f73863b77f9ee4681bbe7

Change-Id: Id6bfd9595f0772a63d1096ef83ebbb6cd630fafd
Related-Bug: #1622914

commit_message:
Check ceph backend connection on driver setup

Check that ceph connection really works when setting up
the driver instead of doing real connect later in init_host
phase. This mitigates the risk that the service crashes/respawns
in an infinite loop because of a connection error.

Change-Id: Ia71b55dab1535ce351310108aaf53304b15ab757
Closes-Bug: 1640169

commit_message:
Avoid creating tasks with empty nodes list

For a granular deploy when a node is deleted and deployment is
triggered the list of nodes for deploy is empty and all remaining nodes
are in the list of affected nodes. This causes nonreexecutable tasks to
appear in the list of tasks with empty uids array.
This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I7377c50df87d1f2448ac2bc775840738d535d7fd
Closes-Bug: #1628500

The bootstrap-aio role reconfigures sources.list by greping for a
pattern in the existing sources.list file. From the results of the
grep, register the base and security repos with the first stdout_line
instead of the entirety of stdout to avoid unexpected newlines and

commit_message:
Configure AIO sources.list with first matched repo

The bootstrap-aio role reconfigures sources.list by greping for a
pattern in the existing sources.list file. From the results of the
grep, register the base and security repos with the first stdout_line
instead of the entirety of stdout to avoid unexpected newlines and
additional repo URLs.

Closes-Bug: 1638878
Change-Id: I64e79701c3ecc62ddec5e7ed86501ca3a94d8f3d

Change-Id: Ib9e954feea2cec38dd8328ada35005c0311c2a1b
Closes-Bug: #1639187
Co-Authored-By: Michael Turek <mjturek@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable PXE for systems using petitboot

Petitboot systems do not use the pxelinux.0 loader. Instead,
petitboot itself handles pxelinux functionality. A side effect of
this is that petitboot requires DHCP option 210 (tftp path-prefix)
as this information is normally derived from the boot file name.
This patch uses the value of tftp_root as a path prefix and makes
the PXE module honor that prefix.

Change-Id: Ib9e954feea2cec38dd8328ada35005c0311c2a1b
Closes-Bug: #1639187
Co-Authored-By: Michael Turek <mjturek@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove duplication of the Zaqar message format

Use Mistral Ad-hoc actions to create our own action that wraps the
zaqar action. This means we can reduce the duplication of the
message format and ensure it is consistent.

TODO:
- This change has the side effect of slightly changing the format
  of some of the messages as I am not sure if we can merge dicts
  easily? Need to resolve that.

Change-Id: I52d11da46d8c61b7455cb69673e7866bd6de5014

subject: host_info: add ability to filter list of supported vifs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-08 13:10:29.000000000', 'files': ['os_vif/tests/test_os_vif.py', 'os_vif/__init__.py', 'os_vif/tests/test_host_info.py', 'os_vif/objects/host_info.py'], 'message': 'host_info: add ability to filter list of supported vifs

The HostInfo object reports information about all plugins
installed on the host and which vif types they support.

When configuring a port for a particular instance though,
the service host may only support a subset of vif types.

For example, if the VM does not have shared memory, or
is not using virtio-net, then it is not possible to use
the vhostuser VIF type. Thus users of os-vif need to be
able to filter the HostInfo data to restrict to to the
subset of vif types that are actually usable in the
particular usage scenario.

Rather than having the compute node pass across an
arbitary set of information to os-vif, to have it do
filtering in the os_vif.host_info() method, add an API
that lets Nova filter the host info explicitly.

For example, when configuring a instance's port Nova
would do

   supported_vif_types = ["VIFBridge", "VIFOpenVSwitch"]
   if ...instance has shared memory and QEMU > 2.1.0...

Change-Id: I1f8c8ae49b767b7684f60cd9cac153fc9ab42088
'}]
commit_message:
host_info: add ability to filter list of supported vifs

The HostInfo object reports information about all plugins
installed on the host and which vif types they support.

When configuring a port for a particular instance though,
the service host may only support a subset of vif types.

For example, if the VM does not have shared memory, or
is not using virtio-net, then it is not possible to use
the vhostuser VIF type. Thus users of os-vif need to be
able to filter the HostInfo data to restrict to to the
subset of vif types that are actually usable in the
particular usage scenario.

Rather than having the compute node pass across an
arbitary set of information to os-vif, to have it do
filtering in the os_vif.host_info() method, add an API
that lets Nova filter the host info explicitly.

For example, when configuring a instance's port Nova
would do

   supported_vif_types = ["VIFBridge", "VIFOpenVSwitch"]
   if ...instance has shared memory and QEMU > 2.1.0...
     supported_vif_types.append("VIFVHostUser")

   host_info = os_vif.host_info(supported_vif_types)

Change-Id: I1f8c8ae49b767b7684f60cd9cac153fc9ab42088
